Pretty annoying.Other than that, the monitor is pretty good, although even in bright rooms you have to use the IR.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Rakhi Aagarwal "rak"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product afetr a long reserach on amazon as a gift to my brother. The product stopped working afetr a couple of use. Very disappointing and embarrasing!

Reviews.Title: Too bad
Reviews.Author: Anastasia
Reviews.Content: We purchased it for our newborn daughter and were super excited to give it a try since there are so many great reviews and the rating is pretty high as well.Well... It is probably one of the most disappointing purchases we've ever made. First of all it feels cheap as a kid's plastic toy and what's more important- the coverage is ridiculous - the monitor lost the signal being only 1 room away from the nursery in either direction.Quality of the video is good though not convincing enough to leave this item.Returned.

Reviews.Title: Reliable & Decent
Reviews.Author: Katie Carroll
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the monitor. We've had it now for almost a year and I can say we love it. Its very simple, not a lot of bells and whistles but super easy to set up and gets the job done. We travel with it too and it does great. We get great reception even when going to far ends of the house and outside.

Reviews.Title: Camera stopped working after 1 month
Reviews.Author: jaydensmom525
Reviews.Content: I bought this item based on the great reviews that is why I feel compelled to leave a review. I ended up returning this item after 1 month. The picture quality was great and I found it easy to use. However it did mess with my wifi and then after 3 weeks it would lose its signal during the middle of the night I would lose sight of my baby. Then at around 4 weeks it stopped working completely. It just read no signal when you would turn it on. I could be standing in the same room as the camera and the monitor would still read no signal. Thankfully amazon did gladly take it back and promptly issued me a refund. They really have an amazing return policy which I am thankful for. It seems like nearly every video baby monitor can be hit or miss. I am not sure if it was just my unit but either way I would not recommend this item if you want something for the long haul.

Reviews.Title: WASTE OF $$$$
Reviews.Author: Shu Chen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in May. The picture quality is terrible, not steady at all. What's worse is the audio, it doesn't come thru......Despite the crapy quality, I kept the monitor anyway since it's cheap. After two month of using, now it's wifi is broken, the screen turns black and searching for signal every two minutes....It's cheap so what? It DOESN'T work, it's a complete waste of money!!!

Reviews.Title: The A/C CHARGER Doesn't work after 2 days
Reviews.Author: Hugo E.
Reviews.Content: i am really dissapointed with this product, i put it to watch my baby and what was the surprise? the a/c power charger does't work after 2 days , i really hate this product and i will send it back.

Reviews.Title: Cheaply Made Baby Monitoring Device
Reviews.Author: Jon Holland
Reviews.Content: I am mainly to blame for being disappointed as I did not research this product enough, but went off a friend's recommendation. For $30-$40 more I feel I can get a much better product. The devices themselves feel "cheap" right out of the box. Cheap parts, plastic, sound, etc... I appreciate the "auto-sleep" feature for sound and video, but you have to wait for it to shut off as you cannot do it manually. To be honest, I rushed through the product manual so I cannot say for sure that it doesn't have this option - although I am quite confident it does not. There are "power-on" lights on the camera itself that leaves the room in an eery green color. I like it completely dark and would expect the same for my baby, just a personal preference I guess. I will say it is good at coming on after sleep mode when there is a noise in the room. I had trouble getting the battery to charge at first. You had to make sure the metal touches metal when putting it in the housing. The friend that recommended it to us said that their battery was no good after a year, but I will probably end up returning mine so I can't say how long our battery would last.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for us
Reviews.Author: Jessi
Reviews.Content: At about a year old, my daughter reached a point where I couldn't go in to check on her at night without waking her. My husband and I needed a way to be able to see her after putting her to bed without waking her up, and this is the perfect solution for that.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Kirby L. Brown
Reviews.Content: Video is a bit more pixelated than other monitors. The max volume is very soft compared to other monitors as well. Nighttime infared is ok but the daytime color video is pitiful. It even seems to glitch between blk and white mode and color mode sometimes (even in a very well lit room). Screen size is nice, clip is convenient plus the option to add up to 3 additional  cameras is also a nice feature. Unfortunately the negatives out way the positives. Not the worst device and it may work for some but I'll be sending this back. Spend an additional $30 - $50 and get yourself a nice monitor with fewer shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing. Both the audio and video fail after a few months
Reviews.Author: C. Davis
Reviews.Content: We have had this monitor for 6 months now. First the picture started to go in and out and now there is no sound at all. We woke up in the middle of the night to our son screaming, and the monitor didn't pick it up! Unfortunately the quality control for baby monitors is awful as this has happened with another brand as well. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: No sound? No WIFI? No Thanks.
Reviews.Author: DashNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this product hoping to save some money. Big mistake.* Poor audio quality. In the past we've used our friends' 15+ year old analog baby monitor, and it had an outstanding sound. My wife could whisper something very very quietly near the baby, and I could hear it better than if I was standing next to her. With this product I can't hear her at all, even when there are no other noises, e.g. the AC is turned off.* Audio doesn't work at all when AC is on* Interferes with WIFI!!! I had to turn off the receiver piece in order to access the internet on my iPad Mini. Turned the receiver back on, and the WIFI stopped working again.I've returned this product and ordered a more expensive one.

Reviews.Title: Good video but horrible sound
Reviews.Author: Angela M Stoner
Reviews.Content: The monitor itself is easy to set up and the video quality is very good.  However, the audio with this monitor is horrible.  We can hear our 2 year old daughter calling us (barely), but can't make out anything she is saying.  We sent our first one back thinking we just had a defective unit, but the second one was the same.

Reviews.Title: Overall fantastic, but has a few quirks
Reviews.Author: Amie and David Allen
Reviews.Content: Bought this monitor in December and we love it! It's great to be able to keep an eye on the baby and see if she's really sleeping or not! The night vision is a fantastic feature. I like that you can purchase more cameras and still use the same monitor to keep track of them all. I would absolutely buy it again, it's been perfect for us paranoid first time parents.  However, there are a few quirks:The battery life SUCKS. Just a few hours. If I unplug it and have it next to me after I put the baby to bed at night it will die before I go to bed. There is VOX mode which conserves battery, but I have found that it sometimes doesn't activate even when Baby is making noise so I prefer not to use it, so I just carry the charger around with me. Annoying, but not so annoying that I would return it.It says "full color," but I have never seen it in full color. Maybe that's because I keep my daughter's room pretty dark? I have only ever seen faint colors on the screen when the room is REALLY illuminated.On occasion, the thing will freeze and I have to take out the battery and put it back in and plug it back in for the picture to reappear. Only takes a few seconds and has only happened a few times.The screen is really bright, even when the brightness is turned all the way down. I have to put it face down on my nightstand at night because the brightness would just keep me up!All in all though, I would purchase this again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Only worked for one month
Reviews.Author: emily Gottschalk
Reviews.Content: When we bought it it worked great but after only one month it only works while plugged in.  So lame!

Reviews.Title: We returned
Reviews.Author: J. Jaeschke "NATANDADDIEMOMMIE"
Reviews.Content: It is an okay monitor but we were used to a pan/tilt/zoom that was much higher quality and thought we would go this route to save money. Unfortunately it was just too cheap  and flimsy to us after the other one and it didn't hold child in screen at all if they moved so it wasn't the monitor for us in the end. I will say though- for a younger child that doesn't move around a whole lot yet it would work and it does have excellent picture and range- which is definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and unable to buy replacement receivers
Reviews.Author: RivertonUT
Reviews.Content: Pros:Price - a video monitor for under $100 seemed too good to be true. It does work, the night vision also works well.Range - I haven't had an issue with it not working inside or even outside the house.Automatically turns off if there isn't sound.quick response from customer service - I sent an email to customer service about an issue, and received a response about 2 hours later. (see cons)Cons:Cheap- about a week after we bought it, it fell off the nightstand onto carpet, and broke the antenna.  It continued to work, so not a big dealCheap- a week ago it fell, this time onto tile, and the whole thing came apart.  I know I can't expect electronics to be indestructible, but this destruction was surprising given how short of a fall it was.  We got it back together and it works pretty well while plugged in.Customer Service isn't helpful-While they responded about two hours after I sent a request to be able to buy a replacement receiver, I was told I should instead buy the whole package again, and have two cameras.If you are planning on buying this, my recommendation is to put the receiver somewhere it won't ever be touched.  Think you may possibly knock it off the nightstand when your baby starts crying in the middle of the night, plan on it being broken.My advice to the company, if you are going to sell something so easily broken, offer replacement components.

Reviews.Title: Not a trustworthy monitor
Reviews.Author: Hannah Jane
Reviews.Content: We received this as a shower gift.  I put it on the registry because of all the good reviews.  I wish I had paid more attention the the bad ones.  Everything they say is true.The Voice Activated mode (VOX) is off the audio drops out.  The video is patchy.  The battery life is a joke.  Even in power saving VOX mode it dies after an hour of use.  Imagine thinking your baby was having a great nap.  You go to check the monitor and wake it up from VOX mode only to discover the battery is dead.  You turn it on and discover your baby is screaming!  Horrible!  What is the point of having a monitor you have to check every 5 minutes to make sure it isn't dead.We charge it every night and turn it off when not using it and still the battery only lasts an hour after a month of use. The audio drop out is equally bad because it may look like you baby is sleeping, and assume they are because all is quiet- but no.  The audio has dropped out and they are crying.I contacted them and all they did was mention VOX mode and the monitor going to sleep.  Yeah, I know. I referenced that mode in my initial email.  Thanks.Don't bother with this.  If you do get it, don't throw away the packaging.

Reviews.Title: Not a fan
Reviews.Author: llewilli
Reviews.Content: We bought this video monitor as our back up while I was having our Summer Infant Touch Video Monitor replaced (don't buy that one either).  This is a good back up monitor for traveling in my opinion.  But as your main monitor, it stinks.  It is impossible to get the camera angled correctly.  The picture is grainy.  The sound goes in and out.  And, when you turn on the monitor it beeps really loudly.  So, if you are trying to make sure the camera is angled correctly by turning on the monitor (while you are in the nursery), it beeps really loudly and can wake up your kid.  It also beeps when it loses signal.  Then ironically, when the battery is dying on the monitor, it makes no noise, but the power light starts to blink.  90% of the time I don't notice this and then I look over at the monitor and it's turned off b/c the battery is dead.  Now, I was probably spoiled with the Summer Infant Touch which has a great camera that you can control remotely (but that monitor is awful b/c it doesn't work for very long), but I still think this is not a good monitor as your primary monitor.

Reviews.Title: Better
Reviews.Author: Kearney Momma
Reviews.Content: We (grandparents!) got this to have at our house. If it wouldn't have been in so many pieces/packaging I would have returned it right away and purchased an audio monitor. But we got it working and it is pretty good.  I just don't like the appearance of it. Looks cheap.  But It really works fine and there's nothing wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you have 802.11b/g wireless products
Reviews.Author: druley
Reviews.Content: Ignoring the mixed reviews about Wi-Fi interference we got this monitor and tried it out.  While having the monitor on and trying to watch Hulu on our Xbox 360 we kept getting disconnected.  After some research we came across the article below and realized that the monitor was designed (FHSS feature) to reduce interference from other 2.4Ghz products but would cause significant interference for those other products.  The article in the link below does a much better job of explaining the issues.[...]

Reviews.Title: Don't be fooled
Reviews.Author: Leah Kimberley
Reviews.Content: by the $300 monitor for $99 like i did. After reading the reviews this seemed like the right monitor for us, after all it has a rating of 4 stars. We were sorely mistaken.  Here are pros and cons we have found.Pros1. Big screen that works2. Light weight3. The only reason this got 2 stars from me and the only saving grace is that is has good picture quality. In the dark i can clearly see if my daughters eyes are open and she is awake.Cons1. In the picture of the monitor it looks like it comes with 2 power adapters. Mine only came with one. You need the second adapter because the battery will not last all night, effectively not hold a charge. It dies after 4 or so hours. The part that stays with you so you can see the baby needs to be plugged in if you want to use it overnight, but the camera has to be plugged in in order for it to work. So 2 adapters are needed.2. If you have a big house or even an average sized house, this is not for you. It says it has a 800 foot range but i believe it is less than that maybe more like half that. The "out of signal" beep and screen comes up all the time when i am trying to get things done around the house.3. After about a month of use the feedback from the volume got so loud that you can't hear anything that is going on in the nursery. So i have to keep the volume on zero so i don't here a loud buzzzzzzzing noise when it is on. The louder you turn up the volume, the louder the buzz is. So functionally there is no sound. That's a problem, that is why i bought the thing, so i could see and HEAR the baby.I wish i had paid a little more attention to the negative reviews of this product before i bought it. I should have been more suspect of the $300 monitor for $99, there is a reason why it is $99. My advice- spend a little more and get something that doesn't have reviews all over the board. I wish i had.

Reviews.Title: Good Monitor - Conflicts with WiFi
Reviews.Author: Joel C. Davis
Reviews.Content: Good Monitor for the Price.  Beware that it absolutely will interfere with your Wifi.  My wife and I started to notice we had trouble with our Wifi in the evenings as we watched TV together or played a game.  We thought it was because internet usage was higher in evenings.  Then I noticed if it was just me in our living room in the evening watching TV the internet worked great.  The minute she came in the room the internet would stop working.  It started to be a big Joke about how she was cursed and I had once put a hex on her for obsessive Facebooking and the internet gods must have listened.  Then 15 months later....Yes, it took us 15 months to figure this out...I glanced at the Monitor sitting next to the laptop and the lightbulb finally went off....The minute I moved the monitor to the opposite side of the room the internet began working again.  We got a good laugh about it, really about how long it took us to figure it out, of course the internet stopped working when she came in the room, she always had the monitor.  Long story short, this monitor will affect your wireless.

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Ferreira Godinho
Reviews.Content: Good relation cost/benefit.I recomended this product. the signal could be better in reception to gain five stars rate.Actually this product is good

Reviews.Title: Not working!
Reviews.Author: PD
Reviews.Content: Was excited to receive the item; however after the one time it worked, the monitor doesn't charge anymore! Don't know if its the charger, monitor, or the battery but right now it's a waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Bad customer service
Reviews.Author: nadine
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for less than 6 months. All of a sudden it stopped working. When I plug the unit, the red light indicating the unit is charging would not come on. I wiggled the cord, nothing would happen. I removed and put back the battery, nothing happened. I plugged the camera cord in the unit, nothing happened. I called customer support, which Infant Optics website touted as 24/7. Whoever picked up the call did not even introduce themselves in a professional manner. It was a simple "hello?" which made me think "did I call the right number?" I explained the problem, the person said I would get a call back within 12 hours. 24 hours later, still no call. I follow up by calling them myself. It was the same unprofessional "Hello?" I am wondering at this point if I am calling someone who is running this business out of their garage ... I explained the situation one more time and that I had not been contacted yet. The person took my information. I asked her what should I do if I don't get a call back again? She said, well keep calling until they call you back. The answer did not sit well with me. I have a full time job, an older mother to care for, a deployed husband and 9-months old. Needless to say, calling until someone calls me back is not my idea of convenience. I wanted to return the product at this point and buy another brand. I waited and still no call. So, I contacted Amazon hoping they can help by putting pressure on the seller. Amazon rocks! Because they fulfilled the order, I was allowed to return it for a full refund. Thank you Amazon! I checked my email today, I finally got one from Infant Optics, 4 days after I originally contacted them. It was not helpful because it was telling to trouble shoot the product, which I had already done. So, not only did not call back on time, they ignored what I told them over the phone about the problem and what I had done to trouble shoot it. If you have a baby and need a reliable product and customer service, do not buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a few months, then died.
Reviews.Author: Stretch
Reviews.Content: Let me begin with the fact that the monitor worked acceptably well for about four months.  After that it just died a slow death cutting off and on unexpectedly.  I suspect that it may just be the lithium battery however, the manufacturer makes it very clear that they do not warranty the rechargeable battery.  And the unit will not work on its own while plugged in without the battery (or at least mine would not).  Emails, which the manufacturer recommends vice a phone call, to customer service have not been returned.  Very disappointed overall and Amazon will not accept it back as a return without prorating my potential refund after I return at my own cost.I will lay out the pros and cons below for those of you that want to roll the dice with this product.  My issue could just be bad luck however I suspect that this is an endemic problem with the product:PROS:- Value:  Great potential bang for the buck.- Picture and sound are good and night vision works well.- Voice activated auto off and on feature works relatively well and is sensitive (maybe too sensitive but I like knowing that it is picking up our little one's noises).- Has a wall mount (and stand alone mode) for camera which is a must when you want to look down into the crib.- Played very well with the two WiFi routers in my house.CONS:- Monitor is light and feels cheaply made.  If it hits the ground, this thing is toast.- Lithium battery doesn't last long at all, even on the battery saving mode with voice activation .  You will be lucky to get an hour or two off the charger.- No low battery or shut off audible tone.  Which means when this thing dies you will have no idea that it has stopped monitoring your little one.  This is a big issue and is unacceptable when you experience the issues as I detailed above.- Makes a "click" sound when it is activated.  It isn't super loud but at night it will wake you and is super annoying.- Loses signal with camera frequently, even when in close proximity.  It will regain signal after a simple reset, but this is really annoying as well.- Uses side volume and contrast up and down button in combinations to activate features like voice activation.  Easy to use once you get used to it however try teaching it to the grandparents or babysitter on the fly and you will see why this is such a bad idea.- In comparison to other cameras with night vision, the LED lights are very bright.  While the light is much less than say a dim night light it is still not up to par with other comparable cameras.- Kick stand for monitor is flimsy and doesn't hold up the unit very well.- Monitor antenna is just begging to be broken off, again poor construction overall.

Reviews.Title: Works really well but we have wi-fi interference
Reviews.Author: Vincent Bronte "Ciela"
Reviews.Content: The monitor itself works brilliantly.  Very good for the price.  Our only issue is that we have had wi-fi interference which has rendered our internet connection slow and our Air port useless.  That's the only bummer though not everyone seems to have this issue.

Reviews.Title: The Audio is Worthless
Reviews.Author: T. Daniel Nichols
Reviews.Content: Hopefully you're finding the value in the camera only because the audio is worthless. It's marginally worth it for the camera alone as I don;t know of another plug and play solution at this price point. Because of the lack of clarity in the audio it may prove more unsettling depending on your reason to use it. With out senior grandma it can be disturbing because one can't discern what's being said or what a noise was.

Reviews.Title: Horrible: Can't hear a thing
Reviews.Author: Mandy
Reviews.Content: This product is flimsy and cheaply made, and worst of all, you can't hear a peep on it. It doesn't get much louder than a whisper. It definitely won't wake a parent sleeping soundly. Sound quality is also awful. Picture is not clear at all, either. It interferes with our WIFI, too, which is dissapointing. Do not buy this monitor. For the life of me I cannot understand why it got good reviews.

Reviews.Title: Can't hear, short range, loud beeps when signal lost, camera won't turn back on when unplugged or loses power
Reviews.Author: Guinevere Lee
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this item b/c of all of the positive reviews here, plus I wanted to take this on an international trip with me and it could accommodate 220v voltage. I was very disappointed. There were many negatives:- I couldn't hear almost anything. I was using it to monitor my elderly mother in her room. Even when I turned the voice activation feature off and volume all the way up, I couldn't hear her moan from her bed. I tried to give the monitor the benefit of the doubt b/c the reviews had been so good, but then when she had two visitors to her room, less than 10 feet away from the video monitor, and they were having a full-fledged conversation, I could barely hear a few murmurs if I pressed my ear right up to the monitor's speakers but I couldn't make out a single word! My only other experience with a monitor was Summer Infant 02090 (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0007OD8SU/ref=wms_ohs_product), which has AMAZING sound capture (I could hear my baby *breathing* on this monitor, even from a few feet away). This monitor really didn't help for being alerted by sound.- The video quality was not great. Then again, I was comparing to my only experience with the aforementioned monitor, which has amazing picture clarity, even at nighttime. In addition, the video doesn't turn off, nor can you turn it off, to save battery power. Keeping video on all the time drains power very quickly. This is perhaps why the battery life is only about 3 hours instead of my other monitor's 10 hours.- Short range. I should have read the specifications more closely, but when she was on one end of the medium-sized house (not a mansion) and I was on the other side, the signal was lost and I couldn't not hear or see anything.- Loud beeps when the signal was lost. Um, this is really disruptive when you're sleeping and these loud beeps wake you up at night.- When I unplugged the camera and plugged it back in, the camera defaulted to being off. Which means, as one other reviewer mentioned, if there is a power outage and then the power comes back on, you'd have to go back into your baby's room to manually turn the camera back on. I don't know about your baby, but since mine was a light sleeper, my going into her room meant that I would wake her up. I don't know why the camera has to have an on/off button. My other monitor doesn't. In addition, and this is probably a defect in mine, when I unplugged the camera, plugged it back in, and pressed the on button, it wouldn't turn on. After about 10 minutes, then the on button would work and I could turn it on. This is not acceptable to me.- With my other monitor, I could just prop out the clip and make it stand up on a table or countertop. One step. With this monitor, I have to slide out the clip, then pull it out to be able to stand it up on a table. Plus, the clip wobbles, so it doesn't feel firm and sturdy. I am constantly propping it up or closing the clip, so one step versus two steps is a big deal. Plus this monitor's stand does not feel sturdy.- As other people have mentioned, the plastic feels flimsy and is very lightweight. Some people may like lightweight, but it makes moving the camera a little too easy.I returned this monitor for the aforementioned reasons. I decided to just get another one of the monitor I currently have, even though it's not a current model (I'll get it used from another site). I have a little experience with one other Summer Infant monitor, but that one also had excellent visual and sound clarity.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this monitor!!
Reviews.Author: Jenny9937
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for.  This is the worst product I have ever ordered online.  Firstly, the monitor is extremely light and made out of very cheap plastic.  Which really would not be that big of a deal if the monitor worked properly.  There is no function which allows the handset to turn on/off the video only (you can turn off the sound only but have to turn off the entire device to turn the video portion off).  I mounted mine on the wall and it was very difficult to move the camera around to get the exact angle I wanted.My husband was on his laptop when I hooked up the camera and started complaining about losing his access to our wireless internet router.  Upon further inspection, we found that the monitor interfered with our wireless signal so much that we could not even access our own router (via 2 iphones, ipad, and regular laptop).  Also, I walked into the kitchen with the handheld device and our coffee grinder turned on on its own (we have had the coffee grinder for over a year and have never had any such problems with it).I was so disappointed with this product that I immediately went into our daughter's room (while she was sleeping, mind you) and took the device down to pack it away and schedule a return.  I would rather have no monitor at all.  It was out of the box for a grand total of one hour.We previously had one of the Summer monitors but it broke after 18 months.  I was hesitant to buy another by Summer since I wanted something reliable that wouldn't break for no reason.  I will gladly spend the money to have a quality product even if I have to replace it every 18 months. This product was simply horrible.

Reviews.Title: Three monitors reviewed and compared, you decide.
Reviews.Author: Andrea M.
Reviews.Content: I bought three monitors, no one is "the perfect one", some are good for the price, some are better than others because of the dimension of your home or the type of WiFi you're using. I think the best one (that I haven't tested yet) is the Motorola MBP36 but it sells for $239.Here some pros and cons of the ones I've tested: Lorex LW2451Pros:- Very good video quality- Very good infrared/night video quality- Very good video FPS (frames per second), very fluid video (like a professional security camera)- 3.5" monitor- Charging Docking Station. The battery life is really good because you don't really think about it, when it sits on the station it's always charging (this is a big plus)- PTZ- Button to turn ON and OFF whenever you like to- Good and simple options menu- Good options- microSD for video recording- Video recording with button- Video recording with voice activation- Very good price- No interference with the WiFi (2.4Ghz or 5Ghz)- It works as webcam for Skype when connected to the PC via USB (I hoped it worked wirelessly as well but it doesn't, it's a big plus anyway. Extremely easy installation)Cons:- SOUND TOO LOW (best monitor I've had but this is a deal breaker. NOT SAFE! Wait for new model, hopefully they will change the microphone)- Voice activation (VOX) not working very well (since the microphone is not the best, sometimes you need too much noise and you can hear the baby from the room before than through the monitor)- Not too long power cable. Hard to mount high points on wall Infant Optics DXR-5Pros:- Very good price for the options you get- Good video quality- Very good infrared/night video quality- Good video FPS (frames per second), fluid video- Best voice activation (VOX) I've tried. This can also be annoying since it will turn on on every little movement during the night but I like to see the baby is safe every time he moves or every time he makes a noise, I really like this feature.- Best noise isolation I've tried- Extremely simple options (4 buttons total, very well explained)- Stand included (even if not needed in my opinion, the monitor is alreay designed to stand by itself)- Clip (my wife liked this, she was able to go outside with the monitor on her jeans all the time)Cons:- Awful battery life (constantly in charge)- No button to turn the video ON whenever you like to- It doesn't turn ON on VOX (someone may like this better?). It turns ON on "always ON"- It literally kills your WiFi (this was my deal breaker with this monitor). I own an IT company and I install WiFi networks for companies, there was no way to get this to work with any channel and any router (I now have one of the best WiFi N900 routers installed, the ASUS RT-N66U). If you use 5Ghz band you will be fine but not every device has this possibility. I had to literally shut the monitor down to stream HD movies to my Boxee Box (no 5Ghz available on the Boxee Box), also unable to transfer files between laptops or iPhone- Not too long power cable. Hard to mount high points on wall Motorola MBP33Pros:- Very good video quality- Very good infrared/night video quality- Good video FPS (frames per second), fluid video (better than the DXR-5 but worse than the LW2451)- Amazing microphone, it is actually an external microphone like the ones you buy for computers, it also seem you get stereo audio from it. Just for this kind of microphone, the MBP33 is the safest monitor I've tested- No interference with the WiFi (2.4Ghz or 5Ghz)- When it goes off idleing, you can turn it on pressing any button. If you hurry when you hear something just press a button and look (awesome function)- Long power cable- It doesn't isolate the static noise of the room (the DXR-5 is the best for that) (changing this to a Pro feature. If you hear static you always know the monitor works and it's capturing audio also you can hear your son breathe.Cons:- No Pan-tilt-zoom (PTZ) (you get that with $60 more, with the MBP36. I don't think this option and the VOX are worth $60)- No voice activation (VOX)UPDATE:The MBP33 stopped working about two weeks ago (we were oversea for vacation!), it lasted long time and speakers just break. I've opened it, tried to solder the speaker again, made a mess and Motorola didn't even blink. They, with Amazon, refunded me right away, no questions.I am ordering a new one, same model, right now and change the rating to 5 stars. The Motorola MBPxx It's the best monitor I've tested so far.

Reviews.Title: DANGEROUS (See reason #1).  NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!
Reviews.Author: kbenn
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this camera got such high reviews because it is literally a POS.Why we hate it:1)  No alert/alarm when battery is dying, only a small flashing light, then it will just shut-off with no warning.  If this is your sole monitor, then when the battery dies in the middle of the night, you will have NO idea when your baby is crying since the monitor will no longer be on.2)  The backlight can be very bright and you do not have the option to turn off the video while keeping the sound, therefore, when using it during the night (assuming you leave it plugged in so it won't die on you) it will light up your room.3)  The sound is like your baby is crying inside a tin can - very high pitched.  Not pleasant, especially if they start crying.4)  Its lack of fuctions/options make it worthless.  Yes, it's simple to use, but not worth $100.  It literally turns off/on, volume up/down, brightness up/down... and that's it.5)  The first one we got didn't even work and it was exchanged.  The one we have now has lately been struggling keeping a signal, and has also had issues turning on and off.Thankfully we only use it as a supplemental monitor for the video while our baby is going to sleep and in the morning when he wakes up and we use a non-video (Angelsound) during the night, otherwise, it would have been returned the very next day!  Seriously, save yourself the frustration and spend the extra $60 or so to get a better quality monitor, like Summers Infant, or something of that sort.  We are actually on the lookout for a new video monitor b/c we are so annoyed by this one.

Reviews.Title: Worst baby product I own
Reviews.Author: JHLC25
Reviews.Content: I am online looking for a new baby monitor.  This thing terrible.  Don't be confused/ tempted by the "sale price".  It was never 299.  I bought this over a year ago and was so proud I found such a deal! No, its not a deal. 99 is the normal price, they just want you to think you are getting a product worth 299.  It likely cost about 10 bucks to make it.  It is flimsy, has fallen apart and has never worked well!  It turns off in the middle of the night with no warning, so I don't trust it.  When it is not turning itself off, it will randomly make beeps in the middle of the night (aside from the normal 3 minutes of quiet beep- which is the weirdest feature.  I figured out how to turn that part off at least). This thing has caused me so much stress.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money to get a new one, but after 5 months of this nonsense, I'm doing it! BYE BYE monitor!

Reviews.Title: Does not hear my baby
Reviews.Author: Missperhaps
Reviews.Content: I am fine with the camera, the screen, the weight but the problem is the audio does not hear my daughter who is four month old, even when she cries.  I hear her but the monitor does not(she is not a very loud baby). So I bought an audio monitor after the fact to go with it, which kinds of defeats the purpose. When my in laws and my 18 months old nephew visited, they used it and it worked perfect because he is loud.So im thinking of returning it. But if you have a loud baby GO FOR IT. It is a good monitor, just not for my daughter and me.

Reviews.Title: good for catching feral cat
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I have a semi-feral cat that comes in at night, but hides out.She will rarely trust me enough to let me near her.At times I need to catch her to give her flea treatment, take her to the vet, etc.So, I set up the DXR-5 to monitor her food bowls in an upstairs bedroom.  I rigged a pull string used to close the door from downstairs.Now I can monitor her activity in the bedroom.  When I need to catch her I can pull the string from downstairs, close the door, and confine her.  This has proven to be humane with minimal stress to the cat.I like the system.  The monitor is clear with good color during the day.  In darkness (usually the case) I get a good grey image of her.I have a 2.4GHz wireless router, but it does not interfere.I get good reception from upstairs to downstairs.

Reviews.Title: As advertised but bright
Reviews.Author: Pohodo
Reviews.Content: I have two other higher-end monitors that are in various states of disrepair (combining pieces I have one working), so I was looking for a cheaper alternative. This product does what it says, and is easy to setup. But after having higher end models, it leaves me wanting on a few points...1. There's no way to turn off the video screen so our room is aglow all night when it's on. There's some sort of auto-sleep function, but we use a white noise machine so it wouldn't work for us. It seems like it'd be simple to add an on/off switch for the screen to help save battery life and let the parents sleep in darkness.2. The cords could be a tad bit longer to reach outlets.3. In darkness, the camera has a ring of red lights that form a circle around the lens - I guess it's to indicate that the 'night vision' is on. I could see it freaking out some kids (it's in my baby's room so time will tell).The video and audio isn't even close to my higher end product, but for the price it's quite adequate. I'm sort of torn on a rating because I'm concerned I'm jaded by having had better equipment, but it seems like they still could've made it slightly better by the things I listed without impacting price.

Reviews.Title: Failed to Work After Five Days
Reviews.Author: Keli Jackson Mueller
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I hoped this monitor would work out for us and it did, for about five days. The unit is clearly cheaply made, but it seemed appropriate for the price. After five days of normal use and no drops, damage, bumps, or other issues, the camera stopped working. The monitor would pick up sound, but no picture. It is going back. I'll have to find a more reliable monitor. I suppose you do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: Poor Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box and setting it up, got reception on the parent unit, and much to my dismay immediately had thin colored vertical and horizontal lines across the screen.  The lines were red, green, blue, and even white.  I assume the screen was corrupted in the manufacturing process or damaged in transit.  Sound cut in and out constantly, even with the voice activation feature off.  Baby could be screaming her head off and it was hit or miss if you'd hear her.  The screen got progressively worse and within two days the entire unit was unusable.  Believe me when I tell you, you get what you pay for with this.  Cheaply made, mass produced, made in China JUNK.  Buck up and pay for a more expensive, higher quality video monitor.

Reviews.Title: Much better than I expected
Reviews.Author: DoubleT
Reviews.Content: This turns out better than I expected for the price.  Comparing to other baby monitor of a popular brand we bought for our daughter, this has a great value. That one currently costs double as much as this one.  When I bought that on sale, it was about the same price as this Infant Optics model.  The night vision for Infant Optics actually is clearer.  The night vision is black and white, but I believe that all the monitors, including the security cameras I owned, are like that.  It has two useful features:  rechargeable battery and VOX mode.  The fully charged battery, unfortunately would last about 1 1/2 to 2 hours with the screen on.  I did not check the battery duration under VOX mode.  So-called VOX mode allows the screen to turn itself off after 3 minutes of silence.  The screen will turn back on when the mic detects sound.  This works well during sleep, so that you will not be bothered by the bright screen.  The firmware on this unit must have been changed since the other reviews indicated that the VOX was always on and complained about annoying beeps when it was activated.  I can change the VOX on or off by pressing the volume + and the brightness + button together and there were no beeps when VOX is activated.  Kudos to the manufacturers for listening to the customers.I have a very extensive wireless WIFI networks: one with 2.4MHz and one with 5MHz.  The 5MHz carrying TV signals around the house was not affected at all.  The four relatively new 802.11n routers for the 2.4MHz carry the internet traffic with no problem, but one 802.11g router carrying the security camera signal on this network cannot deliver the signal to the computers when the baby monitor was on.  This performance with interference actually is better than the other baby monitor which was operated also on 2.4Mhz band, but not with spread spectrum scheme.Overall, I am very satisfied with this purchase.  Few days of usage did not present any problem at all.  I would have given it a five star rating if the screen was bigger and the battery lasted longer.  However, considering the low price, this is actually very close to a 5 star product.

Reviews.Title: Good for a few days, very bad after
Reviews.Author: Leomyr Rondon "ljrondon"
Reviews.Content: The item was just as specified in the product website, however, after just 45 days it started to loose connectivity with the camera (no matter how many times you sync it, it did not show video at all). Since yesterday, the night vision led lights stop working!, really bad product.I'm asking for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 2 days
Reviews.Author: Court
Reviews.Content: This worked great for 2 days.  I liked the video it was nice and clear.  But after 2 days it stopped working.  Am returning

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after a month
Reviews.Author: Shoesshoesshoes
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this monitor... at first. After a month the screen had a huge static bar at the bottom and the sound stopped working. My son had woken up and I didn't even know.  I say fork over some extra money and get the motorolla - I'm loving that one! The vendor was fabulous about the return though! Perhaps I got a dud? All the other reviews are good...

Reviews.Title: VOX issues and Video OFF
Reviews.Author: crunchy
Reviews.Content: I've had this monitor for about 2 weeks now.  It beeps in the middle of the night, repeatedly, when going into VOX mode.  Plus, I can't shut off the video at night.  It is just too bright for me.  I'd rather have a camera where I can shut off the video to save power.  Sending this back.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a month or so, but is totally unreliable.
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about this product.  We have a 2 year old and infant twins in the same room upstairs (our bedroom is downstairs).  I thought it would be great to have a view on them all in case the 2 year old did something like put a blanket or inappropriate toy in the babies' cribs.  It was great for a while but now it doesn't work and I'm incredibly unsatisfied and just missed the window of opportunity for return.  We have the monitor plus three cameras.My main issues are these:-The battery seems to only last for a very short period of time.  We've had the power go out from storms, and even though the monitor was plugged in the battery died while the power was out.  Consequently, I didn't hear one of the babies crying until they were FREAKING out (had been crying for quite a while).  I cannot use the monitor unplugged for more than about 30 minutes.-The voice activation system doesn't work.  I've woken up many times recently to the sound of a baby crying upstairs and looked at the monitor and it's not on.  What's the use of a monitor, even a VIDEO monitor, if it's basically turned off?In all, this was a complete disappointment and I can't believe how much money I wasted.  I really wish I could return it or get some sort of credit to try a different product.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Mary Allen
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor a few weeks ago when our four month old moved into her crib to sleep and out of our bedroom. We liked the price of this monitor and most of the reviews were positive, The first few days it worked alright-the video quality was good and it has some nice features like VOX mode, where you can conserve battery life by setting the monitor to only come on when there is noise or movement. We had this for less than a week, using it daily, and the screen slowly turned green, then completely black. We tried trouble shooting like suggested in the manual, but to no avail. We returned this monitor and will be shopping for a new one. I guess you ARE sacrificing quality for price-perhaps theres a reason why most monitors are over $100!

Reviews.Title: interference, interference, interference
Reviews.Author: Mihaela
Reviews.Content: Interference30 days after turning on the Infant Optics, the range on my 1.5 year old Netgear WNDR3700, went to 1 foot, and for all intended purposes the Netgear is now dead.  Coincidence?!?!, maybe, maybe not.  Replaced the Netgear with a TP-Link TL-WDR4300, and after 2 days of hair pulling, the conclusion was that the moment the IO went on, the 2.4Ghz band was completely suffocated, and no device on the 2.4 band was able to use the wireless network.  I replaced the TL-WDR4300 with a brand new Netgear WND3700, and while the 2.4 GHz band is not completely suffocated, the speed on the 2.4 Ghz band drops to less than 1/4 the speed when the IO is not on.Even more InterferenceNot sure exactly who wrote in the "Product Features", "Uses FHSS (Automatic Frequency Hoping System) - jumps between different channels in the 2.4 GHz range which virtually 'encrypts' the data", but... (1) a spell checker sometimes is not enough (hoping you can see that), (2) FHSS is not an acronym of "Automatic Frequency Hoping System". One of the possible acronyms for FHSS is "Frequency-hopping spread spectrum".  Here is an interesting read on this "wonderful" FHSS approach: [...]I'm pretty sure there must be some other method besides carpet bombing the 2.4 Ghz, just to insure encryption... something along the lines of WPA/WPA2.Testing for interferenceA crude, fast interference test, turn on Infant Optics, go to speakeasy.net or speedtest.net and run the speed test. Turn off Infant Optics and re run the test on the same test server.  Repeat the test a few times.  If the results between IO on and IO off are the same, interference is close to none.  In my case, in the case of TP-Link, I CANNOT even run the test when the IO is on.  In the case of the 2nd Netgear, when the IO is on the download speed is 2Mbps, when the IO is off, the download speed is 8Mbps.  Quite a bit of interference.

Reviews.Title: Blocks your home wireless internet connection!
Reviews.Author: CylonCheese
Reviews.Content: I was really excited when I first hooked this monitor up and it looked great. Then, we realized that our wireless internet did not work in our house. Turn the baby monitor and camera off, internet is fine, turn baby monitor system on, no more internet in the house! It runs a on same 2.4ghz channel as most common internet routers do, duh! If you don't need wireless internet in your house this should work fine. ;o)I look at the manual/instruction book and there it is, a nice page in there stating your wireless internet router may be blocked by the baby monitor! What kind of product does that? There are instructions to try and fix the problem, but there is no fix. Tried them all, sending this unit back to Amazon for a refund today.

Reviews.Title: Mommy of 3, not happy
Reviews.Author: acsim123
Reviews.Content: As a mommy of 3 under 3, I rarely have the time to leave feedback for a purchase.  I'm hoping to save parents out there some time!  I have had 3 different brands of monitors, all of the same price range as this (including Summer Infant and Sony).  This is the worst monitor out of them all.  (1) First, the range is awful.  But instead of it just getting static, it beeps every time it goes out of range.  Like a horrible emergency sounding beep.  My two daughters, who usually care less about noises, etc., (think: fireworks, sirens) feared the beeps.  They would cover their ears!  (2)  The camera does not tilt down. This is a huge issue.  I don't normally wall mount my monitors.  We keep them on the kid's dressers or a nearby shelf.  Because the camera doesn't tilt down, I am unable to see down into the crib.  I'm not even sure how you could mount this to get that view.  Weird.  (3) Aside from the range being much less than ideal, the camera you place in your child's room has the worst, spooky looking red glow.  Around the entire lens are little red dot lights. It looks like part of a Halloween decoration in the dark.  My 2 yr old freaked out and wanted nothing to do with it (again, this isn't a common thing in my house. My kids aren't easily spooked).  My husband even agreed with her, and took it out of her room. I'm returning this, and I've already placed an order for another Summer Infant monitor.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but not the best!
Reviews.Author: Sierra Grant
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor because the reviews were decent and I really liked the price of only $99. Well I tried it out for about a week and I was not very impressed with the night vision, I couldn't really see my son too good! Maybe if I had the monitor a lot closer?I especially was disappointed with the sound quality!! I could barely hear my child. I even had my husband walk in the room and talk to see if I could hear him better and I literately had to have my ear up to the monitor.It's not a total bad monitor for the price but I just wanted something better so I went with the Motorola monitor.. Almost double the price but I hear they are worth it!!

Reviews.Title: Good monitor
Reviews.Author: DD1982
Reviews.Content: I'm satisfied with this product and it meets my expectation especially for a digital video monitor for $100. I think this monitor is worth 5 stars because the video clarity is far superior than the ones I've seen or used before. Range is really good, user interface is easy to use. The sound is OK with the automute hard to predict when it comes in and out, which can be toggled on or off. I've owned this for 2 months now and it's been around most of the time at home!

Reviews.Title: Interferes with my wifi!
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: The monitor works well. I would love this thing except for one huge problem. It interferes with the Wifi in my house! While the baby is asleep there is no internet access! Supposedly this monitor switches frequency when it detects others wireless devices....doesnt seem to do it at my house.

Reviews.Title: cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Brice
Reviews.Content: Poor range, quit working in the middle of first night. Difficult to set up. Unable to get video to stay on  Return was easy.

Reviews.Title: Cheap product
Reviews.Author: Melanie Pollner
Reviews.Content: We had to purchase two of these systems within a year and today, a month after the purchase of our second one, it broke again. The antenna is cheap.  The plastic protector fell off of both monitors, leaving the tiny thin metal antenna part. There is no way to fix it.  We tried glue and masking tape and nothing works.  This product is a complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Simple and works
Reviews.Author: TTalT "TT"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tech-geek so I was looking for something simple to use. Alot of reviewers said that this was the easiest one to use out of the monitors out there and it really is very straight forward to pick up. I didn't need a monitor with too many features and functions that I wouldn't know how to use anyway. For the money a great monitor for lazy people.]

Reviews.Title: a monitor that works great
Reviews.Author: Kenny Ennis
Reviews.Content: We love how this is a easy and simple monitor that has great quality. The price is reasonable. I'm not a fan of the VOX function, but other than that, this monitor was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: heather hill
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the good reviews for this product??!! Right out of the box, the product flat-out didn't work! Saying OUT OF RANGE when the camera was literally sitting right next to the monitor unit. i tried EVERYTHING to get it to work, and i would say i'm a tech-savvy person. Nothing, no signal ever. i was trying to save $ with this product but now i'm realizing it was not worth it! And having a 2 year old and 5 month old - i desperately needed this work! don't waste your money!

Reviews.Title: Great price for a quality monitor!
Reviews.Author: John W Atamanczyk
Reviews.Content: I've been shopping for a few years for a video monitor, but always found the prices to be more than I wanted to pay. Finally, I found this no-frills monitor closer to my price range. This is a great solution if you don't need a larger screen or the bells and whistles other monitors have.This was very easy to set up. Just plug it in, and you're ready to go, and all the features work automatically (night vision, white noise cancelling). There are a couple items that could be improved (the battery only lasts for a few hours, so it you are going to have it on all night it has to be plugged in, and the cord is short. Sometimes I wish the the audio could be manually turned back on when it shuts off), but for the price, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: an extra set of eyes
Reviews.Author: vic1089
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item to keep an eye on my newly adopted 7 year old son. He has ADHD and many nights would not stay in bed. He now knows that I have an extra set of eyes on him. Many nights he will lie in bed and watch the monitor, but no longer gets out of bed. I have had it for over a month and it was worth every penny I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Okay monitor
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Spragg "Bronco Fan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after my 85 yr old Mom suffered more strokes. She had to learn to walk again and I wanted to be able to monitor her while she was in bed. It works fine, the problem is the monitor piece doesn't hold a charge. I wanted to be able to go outside , be in the kitchen, etc. the darn thing won't old a charge so I have to leave it plugged in. Very inconvenient .

Reviews.Title: Double camera paired to monitor
Reviews.Author: Blairenty
Reviews.Content: We bought this video monitor with a addon camera to use in two separate rooms. The price was the attractive given the good reviews and #1 ranking in the baby monitor category. This video is crystal clear and we don't have a problem checking if our two kids are sleeping or awake.What I would have preferred in this monitor was a battery indicator and a clock display. Nevertheless, this is a great monitor and I would recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Can't complain
Reviews.Author: Roy
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to complain about this product, and I think it lives up to our expectations. We haven't had any issues with wifi interference or range issues. The screen is very bright to be seen clearly during the day, whilst not being too bright at the lowest setting to disturb our sleep. We have our camera set on the upper floor and the reception does not drop off when we bring the handset unit to the basement that is 2 floors down. We have the antenna set at a 45 degree angle for maximum vertical and horizontal reception. We had some problems with turning off the VOX mode off and we had a live customer service rep pick up within seconds calling the hotline and they were very helpful. This is a good product supported by helpful customer service!

Reviews.Title: Very basic, but quality product
Reviews.Author: CH
Reviews.Content: This monitor works great for us. It is very basic, but works well. We have had it for 15 months and it is still going perfectly. Two things that I wish they would change...1) battery life is low. Not a huge deal if you remember to charge it after each use. 2) You can turn on the video screen with a button, but then you can't turn it off again. You have to wait until it goes off on its own a couple minutes later. Wish you could turn it back off to save battery life. All considered, I would recommend this product for price, quality and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Just okay
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor hoping that there wont be any problem but unfortunately, the monitor won't charge right from the very first day so I can't use it without plugging the adapter to a power source so I have to take the adapter with me every where I need to use the monitor which is very annoying

Reviews.Title: must read
Reviews.Author: Jack McMahan
Reviews.Content: this item is a must with new borns it does what it says and is really great with the night vision so if you are thinking stop and get it you will love it.thanks jack

Reviews.Title: Video monitor
Reviews.Author: Mom of an ultimate frisbee geek
Reviews.Content: It's was a gift for my daughter and son in law.It has come in handy in the transition from crib to a big boy bed.

Reviews.Title: not a color screen and poor sound
Reviews.Author: Ashley Tate
Reviews.Content: So the night vision is good, but daytime picture is not in color and not as clear.  I was VERY disappointed in the sound quality.  Good bit of static and not very loud even when you max out the volume.  Need to trust that I can hear my little one if she needs me and this monitor does not provide the quality or comfort I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: works great so far
Reviews.Author: Kelly Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: when I saw the monitor I worried because it felt a little cheap.  we decided to buy this monitor because it was cheaper than the others on the market and had pretty good reviews.  been using it for a couple months now and it works great.  at first it bothered me that the image always stayed on making our room very bright but realized that I can turn off the camera to dim the unit.  been working great and i'd definitely recommend this product.  also, i'm impressed with infant optics' customer service.  I had a question about the unit and received an email back from the company very fast.

Reviews.Title: Works well with full reception in a 3000' house
Reviews.Author: Greedy
Reviews.Content: We live in a 3000' house and we haven't had a dead spot where this didn't pick up reception. The range is great on this monitor. It's simple and no fuss at all. It's nice to see our baby sleep at night and watch her tummy go up and down while she sleeps. We've owned a summer infant monitor but the video quality does not compare to the infant optics. Unfortunately our summer infant monitor died on us after just 4 months of use, and we are on our 3rd month for the infant optics so I hope this monitor will last.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality - failed within a week!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: At first we were very excited to have this monitor. We liked the portability and the price. But, you get what you pay for. Within 3 days the audio started to fail. Then, within a week, the picture began to get more and more pixelated around the edges. We returned it.

Reviews.Title: Not made with babies in mind
Reviews.Author: Fuf
Reviews.Content: This was great as a starter. Now we are at 6 mos and its awful1) battery doesn't last very long. Maybe 2 hrs. As such, it's not a portable monitor since its needs to be plugged in2) the camera emits too much light!!! As soon as my baby slightly wakes up, the red and green lights attract his attention and then he can't fall asleep again. This sucks3) it can't be clipped to anything. This wouldn't be so bad but you can't rotate it to turn it to point down and into a crib. To get around this we turned it upside down....I wouldn't recommend this one and it needs a lot of improvements that are obvious if the manufacturer saw the product in use with a real family

Reviews.Title: Not loud enough
Reviews.Author: stina
Reviews.Content: The camera has a good quality but the two most important things to me weren't there: the sound (all the way I could barely hear, unless baby screamed loud), and camera stays on all the time, which kills battery fast. My summer infant monitor I can turn the screen on and off as needed and preserve battery, but not on this one. I got this one because of so many high reviews, but it didn't work for me.

Reviews.Title: Wow! (farm use review)
Reviews.Author: WolfQueen13
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased this to use as a barn cam because I breed pygmy goats & going out every 30 minutes doesnt help my nerves any during kidding season which is already stressful lol. I bought this one specifically because of price & good ratings. My current kidding area is probably less than 100ft from house & the cam is attached to the wooden framing inside.Overall im very pleased. Working it along with set up, & installation was easy once I found the area I wanted the cam & marked the points where the screws were to be (it says in the manual. I think its like 5cm apart). One screw was a bit off, but I just hammered it even no issue.Signal is pretty fair considering I keep the monitor either in my kitchen (middle of my house) or the opposite end of my home from the barn. Depending on where I place the monitor it either gets great or OK signal, but it does lose it here & there, but 90% of the time corrects its self shortly after. To remedy the obnoxious lost signal beeping I set the volume to 3 or 4 so I cant still here anything important but the beeping is less noticeable. You also get used to it after a while. If the signal doesnt come back I either readjust the monitor or if that doesnt work I switch it through cams & go back to one & it works. A good thing is that when it does lose it you can still hear some sound if it detects any. I cant picture this losing signal from one room to another.Even though this is made of cheapy feeling plastic its a tough little thing. Ive had dogs' tails catch the charging wire & have had it crash to the floor multiple times. One time it landed smack in the dogs' water dish, which has since been moved, & after a night in the rice in a warm place its still works great (after removing all bits of rice that made inside of course). Recently my mother has dropped it & snapped off the antena...twice xP. After a good round of super glue its good as new. One thing I did note is that even withought the plastic antena cap the wire inside didnt seem to need the plastic piece, but I reattached it anyway ;).Infrared works great & the light adjusting really helps! My issue with this is that I mounted the camera near a corner (cam view cant cover the entire stall which is at least 10x10 so I was aiming for the corner they were using the most) & because I put it a bit too far in the corner I turned the lense to the right. Well in daylight it works great but the IR doesnt go that angle so the bottom right corner gets blacked out at night. Of course after the cam was put in the goats started using the corner I couldnt see *hair pull*.There arent many things I would change but there are a few. I know its not intended for barn use, but I would have the screen view larger. Like I said the lense got maybe a 1/3 of that stall. I do plan to remedy this by getting the 3 other cams when I have the extra money, & ive extended my pens so the does get a new barn anyways (boys get the old one), & I will be adding screws in several places to mount the cams wherever works at the time. The new barn is 10x16 so getting better views should be easier. While the monitor stands up to abuse I would have it more water tight. Its not sealed at all & has open areas where you could stick a syringe or dropper easily. A spilt juice cup would have no issue getting fluid in. Considering this is for use around infants & toddlers you would think it would be more sealed!The last thing is BATTERY LIFE. It doesnt last long, which I knew, but it would ne nice if it didnt putter out every 3-4 hours if that. Thats actually why its kept in the kitchen a lot. I keep it plugged in so it doesnt go out, & I dont realize it. Outside I dont keep it on me because it isnt needed. Generally when I go out for lunch or whatever ill unplug it that way the battery doesnt totally caput, & I just turn it on & plug it back in when I get home.Overall im really pleased with this. I would recomend it, & I plan to get the extra cams & maybe back up batteries & an extra charger.

Reviews.Title: It's nice, when and IF it works.
Reviews.Author: Jessica I Ibonie
Reviews.Content: I would actually give this item 1 star if I didn't like the fact that I can see my son on the monitor (when it is working).I have had 3 children and 3 different monitors and this is (by far) the worst one I have owned. I would return it if I had kept the box, I think I just put too much faith into the positive reviews.I cannot walk from my son's room to my kitchen (and I live in a small, 1 story house) with out it loosing the signal and the sound AND the video going out.I am actually using my old baby monitor instead because of the signal problem, this monitor is basically useless. If I can't go 75 feet with out the monitor not working, why bother with it.The batter also dies rapidly without constant charging.This item is not wort $100. It's not worth $10.Huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: dxr5
Reviews.Author: Tawnbere
Reviews.Content: We wanted a video monitor primarily to make sure our baby is safe while we sleep. We searched around for a reasonably priced monitor that had good night vision, and we decided on the dxr5. We also wanted remote directional control on the camera, but monitors with this feature costs double.The video frame rate is high both day and night, and the resolution is better than expected. We have it placed 5 feet away from the crib and we can see all the details on his face without any problems when all the lights are out.We feel alot safer with this monitor now when we sleep and we are quite sure that we'll be sticking with this unit for a while.

Reviews.Title: Keeps your eyes on your baby!
Reviews.Author: Ash_mom
Reviews.Content: I really love how this product isn't very expensive, yet it delivers more than it's worth. I can now sleep without worrying all night. The night vision is so clear you can see everything that happens. It lacks additional features like alarm clocks and pan and tilt, but the good video/audio plus the range makes up for it.A highly recommended baby monitor!

Reviews.Title: Performs to high standards
Reviews.Author: Nickle
Reviews.Content: Great product in every way. Easy to use, smooth video, signal coverage everywhere in our 1500 feet home, no interference with our router, loud audio. The VOX is a bit too sensitive so we disabled it on our first night. Otherwise this I have nothing to complain about.We plan to add another camera once our second baby arrives in a few months.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: drunkengrappler
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, we decided to go with this monitor. It seemed like the best monitor for the price we were paying. When we got the monitor we set it up and tried it out and it worked great! We could see our daughter and hear her just fine! The only complaint I would have is that the picture looks NOTHING like they show on here! It is not horrible quality but not great either. I would still recommend this monitor to anybody who wants the video option without having to pay over $100.

Reviews.Title: Overall, a nice monitor and system
Reviews.Author: Thirty.9.Della
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this system is simple and lightweight, and easy enough to set up. I have noticed that there has to be a lot of light in the room for the 'night-vision' not to kick on, so most of the time i view the screen it's black and white. But this is no doubt a good monitor and I'm glad I have it. Overall, I think it's the best choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: Monutors
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: My wife loves love's love's love's this product and "a happy wife = a happy life"Infant Optic baby monitor is the best

Reviews.Title: AVOID: the worst items I ever bought on Amazon
Reviews.Author: D. Graham
Reviews.Content: I am shocked at how many good reviews there are.  I even tried to go through the good reviews to make sure I'm not missing something in terms of adjustments, but that does not appear to be the case.  We have a Summer Baby montior, and it is infinitely better, so this truly is just a poor product versus competitors.Here are the issues:1) There is a ring of red lights around the camera.  We had the camera installed over the crib, which meant my son just kept on staring at it.2) The video quality at night is poor.  Not a deal killer, but compared to the Summer monitor, definitely unacceptable.3) The sound is TERRIBLE.  If we had the sound turned over 3 bars, a buzz starts going on and off, on and off.  I'd be okay if it's just a constant buzz like white noisy, but it's sporatic, making it impossible for us to sleep.  There's a humidifier in the baby's room, so maybe that's causing the monitor to go nuts, but whatever it is, it's very annoying.4) The deal killer: for all the annoy sound problems we had, I was still too lazy to return the product.  However, a week ago, my son started coughing up a storm in the middle of the night.  BUT THE MONITOR HAD GONE INTO NIGHT MODE AND DIDN'T WAKE UP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  We only heard the cough through the walls.  By this time, he had coughed for so long he was chocking and throwning up in the crib.  We immediately took him to the emergency room.THIS PIECE OF JUNK IS GOING BACK TO AMAZON.  DO NOT BUY!

Reviews.Title: Best money spent yet!
Reviews.Author: D.Di
Reviews.Content: This is the first baby monitor I've owned but I've tried a few monitors owned by friends of mine.I really think every parent should have one of these cameras at home... safety is a priority!For $100, this is the best money spent yet on our baby.The camera video quality is excellent- I can see my baby breathing at night- a MUST for us. The audio is clear and loud enough. It shuts off the high tone electronic pitched noise when there's silent for a few seconds. I'm a light sleeper so any electronic noise is a big no-no for me. The only time I need to wake up is when she cries at night!The camera is very light so it only took 2 nails on our wall to have the camera setup viewing from a higher angle. Everything worked out great for us.

Reviews.Title: Interferes with wifi, monitor unit a night light
Reviews.Author: Martin Downs
Reviews.Content: I am returning this monitoring system after one night of use. It interferes with the wireless Internet in my house and it does not have more than one band. The light of the screen also shines through the plastic housing of the monitor unit, essentially turning it into a nightlight on the bedside table.

Reviews.Title: very bad
Reviews.Author: Svetlana Sheinman
Reviews.Content: I would not recomend this product. Poor sound quality alot of interferance. Has zero options .Way too much money for nothing.Better of spending a few hundred and getting everything you want that works better.Summer infant moniters are a waist of money as well

Reviews.Title: DRX-5 Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Minney
Reviews.Content: Work great.  I work at home in another building next to the house and I get the reception I need.  The graphic on the monitor isn't very vivid, but you can tell what the baby is doing.

Reviews.Title: awful
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: had this less than 6 months and the sound stopped working. very disappointed, cannot use the device without sound. ridiculous, WOULD NOT recommend anyone buy it. you think the price is better than the others but when it comes down to it the quality is terrible. and I cannot get a refund because the return period is only one month.

Reviews.Title: Not function as Described.. Poor design
Reviews.Author: R. Esteves "Reader"
Reviews.Content: After reading so many good reviews on this product and it is sold at a reasonable price for a monitor that has night vision, I bought it 2 months before my son was born. Here are the issues I found:1. The monitor can't be adjusted up, down, right and left enough. Based on the pictures posted, we were supposed to be able to put this on a table or a shelf facing the crib. (The table and shelf we tried have the similar height or a little bit higher than the crib rail). However, it looks up instead of looks down into the crib where my son is sleeping. We have no choice to put 2 nails on the wall to hang it up to look down into the crib.2. The battery doesn't stay long. After a full charge (charging light/red light goes off), it can only stays wireless for less than 8 hours. 3 months after my son was born, it basically only stays for 5 hours. In other words, we will need to bring the charger with us when we go to a different room.3. When my son turned 7 months-old, the night vision completely went off. We couldn't see him in the night and this is the main reason I bought this product.4. When my son turn 8 months-old, this product turned silent 50% of the time even my son was rolling, standing, talking or playing toys, we couldn't hear anything. We will need to turn off the product and turn it on again, like a reset to get the audio function on track.Overall, we are really disappointed with this product.

Reviews.Title: Review of Infant Optics Video Monitor
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Sanudo
Reviews.Content: The main problem with this monitor is the amount of time on the battery charge. It only lasts 3 hours.  We wanted one with at least an 8 hour charge.  The Amazon website did not show this. I only found this information after we tried it and I went on the manufacturer's website.  Too bad I did not do this before I ordered it.Other than that, it was OK.  The picture was fine and the audio was loud enough to hear.  The sound activation of the video is a nice feature since it saves on battery use.

Reviews.Title: Has some interference
Reviews.Author: RobbyGTX
Reviews.Content: We purchased this to monitor an elderly parent. It works well in light during the day but in the darkness we get sound interference and not very good visual.We feel these two items are not major and would probably buy again.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Linsey kapayou
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera i bought finally broke down and got one. I needed to get house work done without freaking out about every sound :) But the only thing i do kinda dislike is its only in black and white. I think unless i don't know how to properly work it.. But i do love it. Kinda dies fast but whatever.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: thReviewMan "theReviewMan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor because it was the cheapest video monitor available and a top selling product on Amazon.  Well you get what you pay for.  The battery life is terrible.  It only last a few hours unplugged.  This is probably because the screen never can be shut off and also because the VOX (system to silence the receiver when there is no noise) does not work consistently.  So you constantly see the screen on and constantly hear a buzzing noise.  In addition, the audio quality is terrible.  The Summer Night and Day monitor, that I had before and lasted three years before breaking, was a far superior product, but at a much higher price.

Reviews.Title: Everything's great but the price
Reviews.Author: Amber Delaine "Amber Delaine"
Reviews.Content: Luckily, I purchased this item on sale when it was only 1/3 the price and that's the only reason I ended up getting it. I never would have purchased it at the $300 price tag, even as great as it works.It has a color screen for daytime use and a black-and-white screen for nighttime infrared use. There is a power-save feature which turns off the sound on the receiver unless the microphone on the camera picks up a noise.I have had it over a week now and use it only at night and I love it. The picture is very clear, so clear that I can see my baby breathing with the camera 2 meters away in the dark. I haven't used it over long periods, so I can't say anything about battery life on the receiver. I keep my baby beside me in the evening while he sleeps on a futon and I work, but I got the monitor so I could leave the room to use the bathroom or put my other child back to sleep if she wakes up in the night and still see the baby.I'm very happy with the quality. It feels lightweight and cheap, but works so well. I love how small the receiver is - about the size of an iPhone. It weighs very little which is important to me because I plan to take it with us on vacation and I didn't want the huge monitor that the cheaper models have weighing down my luggage. The receiver has a clip on the back that can clip onto your waistband or you can pull it out and set it up on a flat surface like a countertop or nightstand.Having gotten it on sale, I am extremely happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: 3rd time NOT the charm for us...though CS was excellent.
Reviews.Author: Exhausted Mama
Reviews.Content: I honestly have no idea how 500+ people have given this monitor 5 stars...unless they truly wrote the reviews within the first week or month and then never updated.  We went through THREE sets of monitors/cameras (yes, THREE "new" sets!!!) and every single one of them was a....lemon??  I find it hard to believe that all three of ours just happened to be the exception to the rule.  Very, very disappointing, because I wanted so much to make it work (hence the three attempts!).
