We have three little girls to monitor, though our main reason for buying it was for our 4-yr old whose room is on the other side of the house from everyone else, with a door leading outside.  We've barred and locked the door but it's still a little nerve-wracking.  So having a video monitor that would help us see and hear her in the night was a must.  Having a monitor where the video and sound WORK is even more important.  I won't go into detail about the issues with each monitor, I've seen the same issues repeated again and again in other 1-star reviews.  I will say that for us, the customer service was great.  In general, our emails were all answered within 24 hours and there were no questions asked, ever.  Refunds are only in the form of an Amazon gift card, however, so to be aware of that if you want to attempt this camera anyway.  We ended up purchasing a different camera through Walmart and LOVE it.  Ironically, for the monitor and three cameras, it's actually cheaper than this one plus extra cameras.

Reviews.Title: great product, great price
Reviews.Author: Dan in Omaha
Reviews.Content: See my review for the "add on camera".  We purchased this item, monitor and camera, with an extra camera for around $150.  Thoroughly pleased with the sound quality,image quality, range and battery life.  Not WIFI connected, although I like my iphone and ipad, WIFI connectivity was less important to us.  Portability was more appealing to us and ease of use while traveling for instance.  Recommend!

Reviews.Title: Rip off
Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on this cheap looking monitor. The Power Button on the Monitor Unit does not work! It will turn on certain times and not when I really need it. It has been this bad since first day. DO NOT BUY

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: ARBI ZADOORIAN
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand why this lousy monitor has such great reviews. It feels like a cheap toy. Video is very poor quality. Most importantly, the audio has a delay and it's nor clear at all. I guess you get what you pay for. Do not buy!!! Would give it 0 stars if I could...

Reviews.Title: A cheap, poorly designed product with limited capability
Reviews.Author: Zachary J. Rodman "zackeeus"
Reviews.Content: Sometimes--rarely--Amazon reviews let me down. This is one of those time; I don't get the great reviews for this thing.  I've tried a number of different cameras for my two boys (currently aged 2.75 years and 1 month), and this is one of the worst.  It will be shipped back to Amazon presently.Here are the things that make this a bad option for my family (things I wish I would have known before shelling out nearly $200 for the system with one extra camera):1) The cameras and parent unit are CHEAP plastic. They feel about as light and well-made as a Happy Meal Toy. The buttons are cheap, the flip-up camera is really hard to position and it's hard to imagine that either will last with heavy use.2) Setup is way harder than it needs to be.  "Pairing" the camera with the monitor is tricky.  It should be easy.  It's not.3) In voice-activation mode, the key selling feature of the unit, the sound is activated only when there's a noise from the child's room. That's well enough, but there doesn't seem to be a way that I can see of turning off the display in this mode.  So the display stays on if the system is on.  But then again, I have found the system unexpectedly turned off on a couple of occasions. So who know?!4) Image quality is average.  Nothing special here.  I will say that if the camera isn't pretty close to the child, the image is hard to decipher if the room is dark.5) Switching between cameras is not intuitive. Then again, neither is anything else about this system.6) For me, the biggest problem--the camera has no pan ability. If you have an immobile newborn, this might not be an issue. But if you have a toddler who likes to move around, then this camera will not suffice...unless of course you want to position multiple cameras in his/her room.  (But see #5 for the issue with that idea.)I gave 2 stars because the unit turned on and worked, at least sporadically. But my strong recommendation is to pay a few more dollars for a better system.  We also have the Summer Infant Best and it works much better for us.

Reviews.Title: Works, but feels and looks cheap
Reviews.Author: dhop
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement monitor for our Summer Infant monitor. This one has a very cheap feeling plastic casing that feels like it would break if it were dropped. Also when the camera is in infra red or night vision mode there is this ring of red lights that it visible on the camera and at night they could be disturbing if your baby is sensitive to lights in a dark room. Finally the range on the system is not great and when it drops signal an annoying beep sounds which tends to wake us up. All in all, this system mostly works but is the cheapest video monitor set with two cameras on the market, and it shows!

Reviews.Title: could be great
Reviews.Author: Danger
Reviews.Content: This monitor has the potential to be really good.  We've owned it for a year or so now.  It is our second video baby monitor, the first having been the Levana babyview 2.0.  The night vision is pretty good, so is the quality of sound & picture.  Some of the problems we've had have to do with the inflexibility of the camera.  We had to rearrange furniture to get something at a level near the crib that was workable for the camera's limited tilt range.  However, the biggest problem has been the poor battery life.  After just one and a half hours off the charger, it dies.  This makes it hard to do anything after my kids are asleep.  It seems like I just start to get things done, I look over & the monitor is off.  This was very disappointing.  Our babyview had at least 3 hours, many times, 4 hours before the power button would even start to flash.  Even though I'm currently looking for a new monitor for our third child, I will not consider this an option until at least the battery problem is solved.  I originally bought this because of the price, features & the fact that accessories can be purchased online.  I've been sorely disappointed.  This monitor is meant to be portable.  You can't carry around the monitor when you have to plug it in so often.

Reviews.Title: Feels Cheap, Is Cheap
Reviews.Author: RB
Reviews.Content: I think the positive reviews of this camera are misleading.  This camera should cost no more than $40.  It's very expensive at $100.  I promptly returned it.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy, sending it back.
Reviews.Author: Ashlillard
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this monitor.  We are having our second child in a few weeks so I was looking for a monitor that would work for both children (I like being able to see my almost 2 yr old too).  I set it all up and was more than impressed with the video quality, even at night (hence the 2 stars).  The sound SUCKS.  I didn't hear my son unless he was yelling for me and even then it came across as a squeak.  Therefore I end up tossing and turning worrying that he will need me or something will happen and I won't hear him.  I'm sending it back for a refund.  The search continues...

Reviews.Title: One major flaw, otherwise OK
Reviews.Author: Infragilis313
Reviews.Content: the product is not bad at all for the money. the mic is sensetive enough so that if baby is expiriencing any discomfort you will know. the picture quality is OK, nothing to brag about, but you can make everything out in the picture. It seems to always look like its in night vision mode when it comes to color on the monitor. Plastic feels hard and not flimsy, the camera is nice but it would need to be wall mounted if you want to see you baby from the top, because you can either lay the cam flat or lift it up so its on a 90 degree angle. if you place it on a table the camera woul look at the ceiling, once you pull latch the camera is attached to up, it will point towards you (parallel to the floor), but you cannto make it point towards the ground...which i think is the only flaw of this baby monitor. I do not want to make holes in my fall in order to be able to point the lense towards the floor, but it looks like I will have to do so. overall, its great for the money, but not worth more than 80-100.

Reviews.Title: A let down even for the money
Reviews.Author: Nola Ward
Reviews.Content: We are on a mission for a good video monitor and have yet to be successful.  The first one ever was one of the Summer originals, which we loved!  We used it for 4 years and only then lost the video capability.  It had great range.  So when our second child was born we were excited to get some updated technology.  We planned on getting the newest Summer but the price was high and family talked us into the Samsung 3070.  the Samsung has some nice new features but unfortunately way to many problems.  We managed for about a year but now it is constantly out of range even just a short distance away.  The vibration is obnoxious and battery life is hit or miss.  So we caved and bought Infant Optics, which has been a sad disappointment.  We were very excited but when we went to charge it for the first time it would not charge!  My husband played with the battery and still no charge.  Finally right before bed I was able to get it to charge.  The VOX feature is nice but had difficulty getting it into that mode and then once it was in VOX we were not able check on our son, only if he was loud enough to turn the monitor back on.  I cannot ever believe that it was $200+ and i now realize why it is so cheap.  So we are returning it, but are at a loss for what monitor to try next.  We are going between the Motorola MPB 36 and levana Jenna, which means we are throwing cost out of the window.  We really wished Apple made a monitor, because never have problems with Apple products.  Will add to post with any success stories we might have with future monitor endeavors.

Reviews.Title: Cheap flimsy plastic
Reviews.Author: William M Wood
Reviews.Content: I had such high hopes for this moniter due to the good reviews. It is made so cheaply it's hard to believe. It's a joke to pay more than $10 for this junk. Do yourself a favor and don't bother, buy something else. I returned mine right away, it was already cracked in the back when I received it.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother.
Reviews.Author: Stacey French
Reviews.Content: Our great Summer video monitor pooped out after two years (we used it religiously...batteries had issues and it just quit working one day).  We loved it and we needed a video monitor replacement.  This one sounded great for the price and we didn't need anything fancy for our 2 yr old--just want to be able to hear if he needs help across the house or is coughing, etc.  It is basically a piece of junk.  It looks like plastic junk, the reception stinks, and the worst part is that it beeps VERY LOUDLY several times any time it goes out of range (and then again when it is back in range...usually several times in a row) which is typically in the middle of the night and for NO reason.  Like, you didn't move the monitor at all!  There is also no way to turn the picture off but still have sound, so if the voice activation (VOX) kicks on in the middle of the night, usually for no apparent reason, your room will be as bright as daylight until it turns back off.  The buttons are in horrible places, so you can inadvertently turn the VOX off/on or volume up/dn and have no idea until it doesn't kick on when you hear your kid screaming.  I wouldn't recommend this thing to anyone unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: it does mess up wifi, battery does not last long and it quits with no warning
Reviews.Author: wle "wle"
Reviews.Content: it does mess up wifibattery does not last long and it quits with no warningalso, the vox feature doesn;t work if you have a white noise machine in the baby room - the monitor hears it all the time and never turns offsame for auto mutenothing that depends on quietness in the baby room works if you have a  noise machinemy range in the house is less than 50 feetwle

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Renato
Reviews.Content: The product was delivered before the appointed day. Loved the service. I have not used my Baby monitor because I'm still waiting for my Baby, but I'm sure i'll love it

Reviews.Title: Relief for new parents
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Dahl "Pippilongshot"
Reviews.Content: Was the hit at the baby shower and the feedback is the new parents love it and use it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Only worked when in the same room.
Reviews.Author: TD Master
Reviews.Content: The monitor would only work when in the same room as the transmitter.  Tried using down the hall from baby's room and still wouldn't work, much less on the main floor of the house.  Big waste of money.  Will be returning monitor.

Reviews.Title: I DO NOT RECOMMEND
Reviews.Author: Juliana Heilbuth
Reviews.Content: Image and features are good but it works just miserably. When the camera an monitor are turned on they work fine for approximatelly 10 minutes, and after that signal gets very poor even at short distances (in my case 5-8 yards) and no thick obstacles.

Reviews.Title: For the money it's okay
Reviews.Author: J. Larkin
Reviews.Content: I ordered this monitor because my Motorola video monitor stopped working, and I felt that I didn't need a replacement monitor with all of the bells and whistles. I liked the price of this monitor, and the reviews are pretty good. When I received the monitor I was disappointed to find that the battery wouldn't charge and so the handheld device had to be plugged in to work. The sound was also intermittent. I returned it and had a replacement sent, assuming I'd received a lemon. The replacement monitor worked fine, but I'm overall just not satisfied with the monitor for a couple of reasons. First, the sound quality isn't very good. Compared to the Motorola, it sounds tinny and isn't very loud. Second, the transition from night camera to day camera doesn't occur as it should. When I wake up and want to look at my daughter in daylight I find that the night camera is still on even though it is daytime and I can't see her at all. The screen is very dark. Eventually it does transition, but it's never visible early in the morning when I actually need it. The upsides to it are of course the price, the camera has a pretty good visibility range, the night vision is pretty clear, and the battery life on the handheld piece is pretty good. The deal breaker for me is the night to day camera transition. What is the point of having the monitor if you can't always see your kid? If this isn't an issue for you, go for it. For what you pay it's a pretty good deal. I'm returning my second one and getting a different brand.

Reviews.Title: U get what u pay
Reviews.Author: Sdjj
Reviews.Content: I read all the review before I decided to buy this camera. Everyone kept saying it's good day & night so I thought day means the picure will be color and nite will be b&w.; Everyone forgot to mention that this camera is black & white both day & nite.Really u Get what u pay. $99 is cheap that's why it's black & white. I had 1 10 years ago and it was b&w.; I thought after 10 yrs it should be update to color as well. I heard that different brands have color picture for day. If I know this b&w; during the day I would give this a miss & pay extra for color one. Coz I live in Australia, my sister bought it for me & sent it to me so it been a while I don't think I can return it so I'm stuck with it.It's very light weight. Really when I open the box & hold it on my hand, right away I said to myself u get what u pay. It feel cheap, not solid, feel like a toy. Also the adapter is USA ones. I had to buy Australia adapter to transfer. So if u want to buy this I think u should find a local store that sell this camera, go there and have a look and compare. Remember rather pay extra for a real picture during the dayThe signal is not good. Only cam1 is detected but often out of range. Also the sound kept on & off. Went all quite even I have music on for bub 24/7, sudden on then off again. Never stay on for longer than a minute. I'm spending $99 but it not working as it should be such a waste. The purpose of this monitor is to hear my baby crying but the sound is off all the time, what a point

Reviews.Title: stop working after 35 days
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: bought this item and the camera stoped working .wouldn't recommened because at night the night vision don't work anymore .

Reviews.Title: One word, "Average"
Reviews.Author: Chuck Honeycutt
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, and this is true.  This product is a no frills baby monitor, hence the affordable price.  Below are the pros & cons from my point of view:Pros:AffordableDecent video qualityCons:Can't switch to audio onlyPlastic is thin & fragile (concerns about durability)Volume doesn't have great range.  Not loud enough for my taste.Overall, I chose to return this product & spend more $$'s to get, what was in my view a better product.  I am looking for a monitor that will last at least 3-4 more years & I have concerns that this product won't make it (I could be wrong, but it feels cheap).  I also needed a product that could be easily switched to audio only & I needed more volume.

Reviews.Title: Great Product & Great Company
Reviews.Author: Wanni Yu
Reviews.Content: Got this at my baby shower. & am so pleased with this monitor. I've also gotten Great customer service when I've reached out with questions. Great product!Wanni

Reviews.Title: Seems great only if you haven't owned a better quality video monitor
Reviews.Author: Lula McBride
Reviews.Content: We have owned two of the $200 Summer video monitors in our son's almost 4 year old life and when the sound started going on the 2nd of those monitors as it did the first, I thought surely there's a competing product out there that's priced better. So I bought this one based on the mostly positive reviews. Meh. People are clearly only impressed with this one if they haven't ever owned the other. I myself wouldn't use this Infant Optics monitor with an infant. The video quality is too inferior. You would not be able to see details such as the chest going up and down when you want to check the baby's breathing in the night, either out of general nightly paranoia that new parents have or because the baby has a cold or if a child has asthma, whatever. On the Summer monitor you can see that. The Infant Optics picture is really digitalized looking, not finely detailed. It's ok for our 4 yo because all I need to see is if he's in his bed or about to fall out of it as he can sometimes do. I keep the sound on constantly because I don't want any issues with not hearing him call for me. The camera that's placed in the baby's room - nobody has mentioned this and I can't fathom why - it is lit up all bright like a freaking UFO. It's crazy. It lights up the room enough to almost serve as a night light. There are several bright bright red lights around the eye of the camera and a blue or green light on top that bounces off the ceiling illuminating the room. (I covered up the top light and it helped; on the Summer monitor it had one bright green light and I always covered that one too.) To people with new babies, or parents of a child who really struggles to fall asleep, your child may lay there and stare at the red lights, not fall asleep. And there's no way you could do something like we did with the Summer monitor, which was place the camera inside the crib just a foot away from our swaddled newborn so we could see him so close up we could monitor his breathing all night very easily both by sight and sound. If you put this camera inside the crib your baby would not sleep a wink all night long. I'm really glad I saved our old faulty Summer monitor because I don't have a huge amount of confidence this one will last very long, based on how flimsy it feels. But that's an impression not an actual experience with its reliability. Will check in later in that regard. Still, another reviewer said they wished they'd just sprung for the Summer monitor again and that's how I feel too in comparing the two products.Update: I am returning this monitor. I'm done. I was already not happy with the quality of the sound and last night what I suspected would happen did happen -- my son woke and called for me and I didn't hear it at first because the sound was so quiet, muffled and distorted. He's saying "Mom" but all I could hear was a weird sound that reminded me of recordings of whales singing underwater. It's ridiculous. In fact I think Amazon should investigate the legitimacy of the 5-star reviews of this product because I can't imagine any parent really finds this sound quality acceptable.

Reviews.Title: it stop working after less than 2 weeks from baying it
Reviews.Author: SHAIKHA alraqem
Reviews.Content: it stop working after less than 2 weeks from baying it i have to return it back what waist of money

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: ABP488
Reviews.Content: I had bought this monitor back in july when my daughter was 4 months and I was ready for her to be full time in her crib. I purchased it based on reviews and the appealing price. First and foremost the battery life SUCKS. It tells you its dying by a tiny green light blinking and quickly goes dead. It definitely poses a hazard to someone who might be sleeping and forgot to plug it in next you on your night stand bc it does not beep or alert you other then a blinking light. When you plug the handset in it has a bulky wire that weighs it down and falls off the surface constantly that you leave it on if you dont position it properly. Well besides the monitor falling almost everytime i place it on the surface...from falling constantly first the antenna plastic cover broke off. Now the screen has sunken in and the sound has stopped working. let me clarify that i take care of things very well i am an anal neatfreank but this monitor was relentless to falling over. I would never reccomend this to anyone. I now have to purchase a whole new monitor and IM DEFINITELY NOT BUYING THIS POS AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: Chris's review of Infant Optics DXR-5 2.4 GHz Digital Video Baby Monitor with Night vision
Reviews.Author: Gift
Reviews.Content: It seemed like the pictures. It was given away for a baby shower. I will not know until after January 30th.

Reviews.Title: It was a gift
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: HI, This was a gift for a baby shower and the baby is due in December, so i am hoping this works as stated. Sorry, not much of a review.

Reviews.Title: Forget buying this
Reviews.Author: K. Hyde "Kirk"
Reviews.Content: AFTER FIVE CHILDREN AND NUMEROUS DEVICES, MY WIFE AND I DECIDED TO ORDER A MONITOR WITH VIDEO CAPABILITIES.  WELL, WE COULD NOT HAVE CHOSEN A WORSE DEVICE THEN THIS.  IT IS VERY HARD TO USEAND AFTER A WHILE IT STARTS TO BUZZ.  GRANTED I HAVE LITTLE OR NO PATIENCE BUT THIS WAS A TERRIBLE PURCHASE ON OUR PART.  WE ARE RETURNING THIS.  TOTAL JUNK

Reviews.Title: Works great, as long as you don't use wi-fi internet
Reviews.Author: Jasper Whannell
Reviews.Content: This thing absolutely murders my wifi.  When we first purchased this, I read all the reviews and everyone said that this doesn't affect wifi, so I thought nothing of it.  After a few weeks of using it, my wife calling me while I'm at work complaining that the internet was slow or down, I plunked down $100 for a new top of the line dual band wireless n router (my other router was getting a bit long in the tooth). What do you know, same problems.  I made the connection when I went to my desktop computer (wired connection) and it's internet was fine.  If you put the recieving unit close to your wifi device, you can actually see the blue light on the front of the recieving unit flash that it's losing signal, and your wireless will go to hell or completely stop working.  Not sure whether to ask for a refund or what.Anyone has any ideas, I'm all ears.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Knock Offs
Reviews.Author: Steve H. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Infant Optics website said Japanese parts with "American Touch".  The one that I bought here has Made In China labeled all over it.  I have been using this for two weeks and now the signals starting to drop out more frequently.  Now I am beginning to question its reliability.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Vanesa B
Reviews.Content: I havenÂ't try it yet but is a good product to have in a big house where the nursery is another floor.

Reviews.Title: Overly complicated.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Bill E."
Reviews.Content: Today I took this thing down and put back up our old Summer monitor. This thing works great, in theory. The camera and display are good to very good. The packaging and manual are well done. The problems we (my wife and I) have are with the monitor.The clip on the back sucks. There's no two ways about that. It's this fiddly slide/lock, stand/clip contraption. A simple spring clip would have worked, with a flip out foot also. But, like the rest of this thing, that'd be too easy. The super cheap feeling foot/clip always feels like it's going to break (though it hasn't) and never quite locks in the position you want it in.The screen is good, excellent contrast, and enough brightness that it lights your whole room up like daylight, waking you and your partner up. To boot, the battery is already shot - or it just sucks. I can't tell which. But, I do know it can't make it through a night off the charger, and it seems to forget all the settings when it dies. The most annoying part is the "VOX" feature. It's supposed to only turn on the display when the baby moves or makes noise. Problem is, the VOX feature seems to turn itself off all the time, so the diamond bright display stays on all the time. Also, if a mouse farts or the baby's eyelash moves, the display comes on. My wife doesn't have an easy time remembering how to change the settings, nor what they all do.If we never had another monitor, maybe we'd like this one, but we don't. Our Summer monitor is a big dumb receiver, with a small not very good screen. However, it has a LED noise level indicator, and a simple "whack it when you want to see it" button on top. With that monitor, we turn it on, and if the kid makes noise, we see/hear the indicator "level up." If we want to see the kid, we press the big ole button on top and the video is active for 3 minutes, then it goes off. A simple green glowey LED tells us it's on. All that is too simple for this Infant Optics super complex reads your baby's mind and turns on 99 features when you want 2. If our new baby makes noise, this sucker lights up like the sun for some period of time, then turns itself off. I mean, turns itself off. It SHOULD go back to sleep, but it doesn't. It goes off. I can't tell if it's defective, or the battery is dead. If I plug it back in, then turn the VOX feature back on, it sorta behaves. Until for no reason in the middle of the night, when the kid is silent, the display comes on and lights up everything again. meh. Would not buy again, nor reccomend.

Reviews.Title: It's awesome.
Reviews.Author: Bigchoi
Reviews.Content: Even though I don't use it yet, I could know that this product is the best one which I chose.It is cute and light. Most of all, it has noize sensor. If your baby cry, it will be working automatically. I have never seen like this.

Reviews.Title: Works, but is not durable
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Chambers
Reviews.Content: Bought this almost ten months ago.  On arrival, the battery connection to the monitor unit did not function.  My husband gently bent the three metal prongs in the monitor unit that make contact with the battery poles to get it to turn on, and we had to fiddle with the battery periodically to make it work.  After traveling with the unit a few times, the monitor stopped charging.  We turned the cord where it plugs into the monitor until the red "charge" light came on.  After a few weeks of intermittent functionality using that technique, it stopped working altogether.We like having a video monitor and it is the cheapest on the market, but it seems like the components are very cheaply made and do not withstand ordinary use.

Reviews.Title: crap monitor if you have wifi
Reviews.Author: Anonymous shooter
Reviews.Content: steps all over the 2.4 GHz range.  Sent it back to buy another unit from another brand.  otherwise OK if you live out of the city and have no internet

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: filthydefex
Reviews.Content: just as there description says. this item works great and for the price you cannot beat it! I recommend this to anyone who is on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: ShoeMama
Reviews.Content: We bought this to replace an older (non digital) Summer Infant monitor that went out.  This is the THIRD monitor we've had since our daughter was born and she's just barely over two.  The first two were Summer Infant (one wasn't portable, and I broke the screen, the second went out on it's own) so I thought I'd try something else.  Oops.My first impression was the sound is bad.  The sound is very muffled and garbled like your kid is under water. I can't make out anything she says over the monitor, just that there is noise.  Well, since all I really need to do is hear her, I figured I'd live with it.But then we moved the monitor because she's in a "big girl bed" and now I can't see ANYTHING on the monitor.  Not that the picture was any good to start with, but you can't even see WHERE in the room she is.  I should have bought the $35 sound only monitor.  It would have been a much better buy!I'm not a huge complainer normally, but I have nothing but complaints about this:* Sound is garbled* Picture stinks* Video doesn't go to "sleep" at night, but sound does, so the light is always on but the sound will go off.  This makes it hard to tell if it's run out of batteries! The summer infant one went to static when the batteries ran out, which is better in my opinionSo, I'd say save your money and get an audio monitor.  The pic on this is worthless, and the audio isn't far ahead.

Reviews.Title: Simple and reliable
Reviews.Author: Daizlemom
Reviews.Content: Love this wireless monitor! Owned this for nearly a year now and it's been very reliable. Nice big buttons and the functions are very easy to understand and use. No auto switching between my 3 cameras but for just over $300 for a 3-camera set, you can't beat it with the money. No surprise this is the best selling monitor on amazon.com!

Reviews.Title: not the best quality
Reviews.Author: baby girl
Reviews.Content: We bought this item after 2 previous camera monitors had broken on us.  The picture quality is ok but not the best and you can tell that there is a very slight (albiet very short) delay.  The battery does not last very long off the charge which causes us to fall asleep only to wake up and it is already dead after only a few hours.  The signal is ok but does not have a very long range.  The initial setup requires you to "sync" the camera with the monitor although the directions claim that the first camera shoud be "in sync" with the monitor (you apparently can have up to four cameras).  Although there are these issues with the product, it is much less expensive than the other monitors that we had and for the quality of the product it is probably priced lower than it could be.  Overall, it works and is inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Ndrea
Reviews.Content: Just got this 3 days ago and I love this video monitor. It's designed thoughtfully and the interface is very straightforward for those who aren't gadget literate. Wished that the screen can be turned off while keeping the audio on, but I cover the monitor with a silk scarf and that does the job. It's nice to see my daughter sleeping at night on the screen!

Reviews.Title: Mic Does not work
Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: Hi, i recently bought tHis product from Venezuela, buey it doen't work well, i doen't know hoy to change o Claim warrantyI wait to recoger my money back, i am not satisfice with This product.ThanksI need your help

Reviews.Title: Sooo cheap!
Reviews.Author: Roman Schwab "Roam"
Reviews.Content: Sorry but this product is build so cheap, it feels like you break it by just holding it in your hand. The video is soso and the sound level even at the highest is way to low. Since we already have a wireless router at our house including iPhones and a iPad, I figured why not spending $100 into a Wireless camera where and use our existing equipment that is hundred times better then this baby monitor? We got the Foscam and even though it was a little though to make it work on the wireless and having to wrap the antenna in aluminum foil to avoid the static sound, I feel like we have a much better setup now and a camera that we can use for security later as well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Camilo
Reviews.Content: Excellent baby monitor. Muy buen producto presenta excelente resolución en la imagen, es una herramienta fundamental para el cuidado del bebe, no debe faltar en ninguna casa es súper funcional, y a un muy buen precio.Me gustaría que estuviera disponible en diferentes colores.

Reviews.Title: Great product (minus a few minor things)
Reviews.Author: LHill
Reviews.Content: We have had this product for about a month now and we really like it.  We haven't had a video monitor before so it's still a luxury for us.  We have it set up so we can see our toddler's bed and our baby's crib.  It's been so nice to be able to see them and know when we have to go in and tell our toddler when to get back into bed.Things we like:-Great price!  You can't beat $100 for a video monitor.-Very easy to set up.  We didn't mount it, but instead used the stand and have it sitting on a shelf.-Brightness control, so it doesn't light up our entire room if we have it on while we're sleeping.Things we don't like:-Battery life is very short. We haven't timed it but I'm guessing it's about 1 1/2 hours tops.  It's not really that big of a deal, we just need to be better about bringing the cord with us and keeping it plugged in.-The biggest thing we don't like is that there isn't any warning when the battery dies.  There have been a few times when we've been in a different part of the house from the kids (so we wouldn't be able to hear them without the monitor) and I've looked over and the monitor was off and I had no idea how long it had been off for.(Neither of these would be that big of a deal if we just kept it plugged in.)Overall, this is a great product and I would definitely recommend it (even with the negatives I still give it 5 stars)

Reviews.Title: Great device for the money
Reviews.Author: nanny
Reviews.Content: This is a great purchase for any new mom. I am a nanny for a little one and I love this product. I can see when the baby is awake and moving around as well as hear her. I highly recommend it. Can't beat it for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: All parents should get this
Reviews.Author: Silks
Reviews.Content: We've had this baby monitor for 2 weeks now and already love it. It's been very reliable and the everyone in the family has found it really easy to operate. We don't have to constantly check up on our baby while busy with something else. For $99, it's the best product we've had for our newborn.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it- horrible
Reviews.Author: J. Malbone
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked this has so many great reviews. It was AWFUL. We've had a motorola and summer infant and this is just a joke compared to them. When we could actually get it to work the sound was sooooo tinny and distorted that you could hardly hear anything. It interfered with our wi-fi and no workaround worked. So to have the monitor on we couldn't use the internet, which was pointless. Very disappointing. It may have lots of good reviews, but it does also have hundreds of bad reviews as well...

Reviews.Title: Stopped working 2 months after 'warranty' period (1 year)
Reviews.Author: Janet "miss_j216"
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this video monitor. 9 months after the date of purchase, the video screen would not stay on during the duration of a 2 hour nap. I'd have to power down completely and turn back on. 50% of the time when I turned back on the screen would read "out of signal coverage", even when I was within the 800 ft "range".At 1 year 2 months after the purchase date, the camera has stopped working completely. When I called Infant Optics they said they couldn't do anything because it was past the 1 year warranty. When I asked how many hours the unit should work, they could not answer. This particular unit was at my mother-in-law's used once a week for 2 hours per day. Total run time for the life of this unit was about 120 hours.I don't recommend this product at all.

Reviews.Title: Camera Positioning
Reviews.Author: EMMANUEL OBINNE
Reviews.Content: Nice product, serves the purpose. However, the camera should be improved for more flexible tilt.Information such as power rating and specification should be included for all electronic products sold on Amazon, most times i need to know whether an electronic appliance can work with a voltage of 100 - 240 because some are gifts to my family in Nigeria.

Reviews.Title: Not for those with 2.4 GHz Routers.
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: Seemed like a great product at first but it directly conflicts with my D-Link DIR-655 2.4 GHz Wireless router. So clear video of the little guy but no internet. Kinda defeats the purpose for us. When else is a better time to watch Netflix or an iTunes Movie than when he is fast asleep under the watchful eye of the baby monitor? I would recommend this monitor but only to those who have a router that operates over the 5 GHz frequency, or if you don't even use the internet. Hope this review helps. I'll be sticking to a 900 Mhz baby monitor that only provides auditory monitoring.

Reviews.Title: occasionally drop signal for no reason
Reviews.Author: nurselaura
Reviews.Content: I was initially impressed with this video monitor.  The price and overall performance are good. Seems to get good reviews. However, I've since decided to replace it.  The reason being is that at least once a week, the monitor in our room drops signal and loudly beeps at us telling us so.  It's plugged in, in the same place every night, signal strength is good/light display is solid.  Everyone is tucked away in bed, not walking in front of it, etc.  We can't figure any reason for it to just drop signal but when it does, it wakes us up, I have to turn the monitor off then back on and then it's fine.  When you value your sleep as much as we do with a baby, this is unacceptable.  Granted, we live in an older house with plaster walls, the baby's room is separated from our room by another room and a bathroom, and most nights it works fine, but other nights, it inexplicably drops signal.  In other areas of the house, the reception is spotty but we've figured out the places it works and yes, if someone walks in front of it, etc, it may temporarily drop signal but then pops back on.  No dice in the middle of the night.  It drops signal and for whatever reason, it stays dropped.  So if one is inclined to sleep through the (loud) noise indicating the signal has dropped, then our monitor is now off.  The baby's camera is mounted to the wall, above her crib.  Seems fine.If anyone has any suggestions, aside from kicking it to the curb, I'd love to hear them.  Again, it only does this maybe once or twice a week, but that's an unnecessary wake up, so it's being replaced.If you live a small house with dry wall, perhaps you won't have this problem.  Our house is 2000 sq ft, not huge but I guess not small enough to transmit the signal consistently.

Reviews.Title: Started out great...
Reviews.Author: Lndz
Reviews.Content: We got this monitor about a year ago, and we loved it at first. We didn't need anything too fancy, just wanted to be able to check and see that our child was staying in bed. We set it up above the crib, we could see him clearly on the screen, there was no static or interference. Loved it! The first thing a I noticed after a couple of months was that it was staying charged for shorter and shorter periods of time. At one point the charger stopped working and we got a new one, however even with the new one the monitor only stays on if its plugged in. It won't hold a charge for even a minute, which gets annoying when your trying to do stuff around the house and can't carry it. The next thing that happened is that the antennae piece broke off really easily, leaving a wire sticking out. Not too big a deal, still works fine. The other thing that bothered us was that you have to keep the camara within a couple feet of the bed or else the screen becomes to dark and pixelated to make your child out. That being said, we are buying another camara for our second child since the price is decent and we don't want to carry around 2 monitors.

Reviews.Title: Sound Quality is Terrible - The rest is Average
Reviews.Author: Ryan Holzer "ccChucker"
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor when our old Summer Day and Night analog bit the dust after 3 years.  I didn't mind that it was light or plasticy.  I didn't mind that it didn't have pan/tilt/zoom. I just wanted a good monitor I could use for my two kids.  This wasn't it.Our main problems:1)  The auto mute and VOX functions were great ideas - had they worked.  But to get the sound to trigger there has to be a LOUD noise.  So basically instead of being able to hear my child sitting up and singing or playing softly, she would have to yell or cry for me to know she was awake.  By way of example, my two year old got a stomach bug and vomitted in her toddler bed one night around midnight.  I didn't know it until she started becoming really agitated and started to yell (she is quiet little one and doesn't cry/yell much).  I have no idea how long she was covered in sick before that finally triggered and woke me up.  The final straw came when, at 2am, she somehow made her way into our room and woke us up to tell us her paci was missing.  The monitor never picked up her calling for us, nor getting out of her bed and leaving the room. Up to that point she had never left her bed or room at night.  Now I worry that the "seal is broken" on that behavior so to speak.  That was the night we decided this monitor went back.Apart from audio the other small quirks that annoyed us:2)  There is no Audio Only mode.  The best you can do is set it on Voice Activated (VOX).  This means that you either have to sleep with the VERY bright display on all night, or you have to wait to have the VOX triggered by something loud. As a parent of a newborn you may not mind having the video on all night.  But trust me, at some point you will mind.  When it IS triggered the screen automatically pops on.  Also annoying at 2am.3)  When VOX goes off after a period of silence, it first flashes to a BRIGHT white "title screen".  That bright white flash itself has woken me up more than once.  It is ridiculously bright and I can't understand what purpose it serves.4)  The night vision lights on the camera are BRIGHT RED in a ring around the lens.  There are plenty of other brands that have invisible IRs.  The red lights freaked my 2 year old out for days until we finally told her they were her own personal Christmas Lights.5)  There is no easy way, once in VOX and there hasn't been an activating sound, to just pop the camera on for a quick view.  I tried pushing the "brightness" toggle and the "P" button on the front of the monitor.  Both worked in popping the camera ON but a) there was no way to pop it back off again until the VOX setting once again triggered, and b) half the time it would somehow then turn the VOX setting off so the camera would stay on and on and on until I checked and reset the VOX setting.I will grant that the video quality and night quality is good.  That's what kept us holding on for so long.  But we just couldn't do it after my daughter needed us TWICE and the monitor failed to alert us. What else is a monitor for?  We could have purchased an audio-only monitor to go along with this one but by then we'd have spent just as much money as getting a better quality monitor.We've since purchased the Summer Baby Touch (thanks to a wonderful review by "Alison" going over that and the Motorola we were considering step by step) and we're VERY happy with it.  It was more money... in fact double the money.  But it bought me peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: adequate
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: somewhat disappointed in the lightness and cheapness of materials....will not work more than an hour on battery. I use it to monitor my elderly mother, at night, and it works ok for that. Would be nice if the light would go off unless movement is detected like some other models...I have to turn it away from me, as I sleepo and rely on the sound portion. It does, however have a pretty good picture and the sound is good enough for my pyrposes.....only for light duty tho

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor sound.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: The day and night picture is high quality in my opinion. However, the monitor hardly picks up sounds. I can hear my two year old yell for me maybe 2 out of ten times. Luckily his room is right beside ours and I wanted the monitor more for video than sound. For my purposes this monitor is good for the price.

Reviews.Title: Honest Review
Reviews.Author: Matthew E Titus
Reviews.Content: Pros:1.  The cost2.  Very lightweight3.  Very thin handheld unit4.  The picture quality during the daytime is excellent5.  Very simple to useCons:1.  The night vision does not work.  We had an Angel Care monitor previous to this that displayed the night vision perfectly.  This monitor does not work in the dark.  Do not buy it if you rely heavily on the night function.2.  Build quality is cheap.  You get what you pay for so not a lot to complain about hear.3. The camera is difficult to mount on the wall.  It could really use a slot to be mounted on a tripod.4.  The VOX feature does not work.  I was in our child's room talking loudly for over 5 minutes and the infrared never turned on and the monitor never turned on.Conclusion:Based on the night vision non function and the VOX non function I will be returning this unit.  Only had it for one day and it is not acceptable in my terms for a baby monitor.  I question all the 5 star reviews after receiving this unit. I would bet that many of those were generated by people who have never used this product.

Reviews.Title: BEEP ... BEEP ... BEEP while you are trying to SLEEP
Reviews.Author: Natasha
Reviews.Content: This monitor is cheaply made, inside and out.  The monitor does not beep when it should, like when the battery is dying.  It just dies without no warning, no beep at all.  But it will beep like a maniac all night long when it goes in and out of reception.If you are considering this monitor with an extra camera to hook up to it, think twice!  There is no way to scan back and forth automatically (like you would need it to do when you are sleeping).  So you would need to buy 2 full sets if you are looking to monitor 2 rooms at night.I've returned the second camera and am keeping the full set as a backup.  Even though I returned the camera, they have yet to provide a refund.Pros: I do not like anything about this monitor.  The "pros" would come standard with any other baby monitor.Cons: No scan option for 2 cameras.  Cheap quality.  Annoying beeping when going in and out of reception and will keep you awake all night.  I hate this camera & monitor!  I need sleep.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Angel David "angel_in LA"
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this monitor based on its rating here, but it's very disappointing. We live in a single story 3 bedroom condo and the monitor gives you the "out of signal" message by the time I walk into the kitchen (100 ft from baby's room). The picture is bad and several of te features (such as "sleep mode" when the baby's room s quiet) never worked at all. The picture stays on the whole time the monitor is n, therefore the battery dies halfway through the night. Piece of junk. Don't buy unless you live in a studio apartment!

Reviews.Title: Worse experience
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor about a month ago and returned twice because it stopped working within one week of buying it. You get what you pay for. I do not recommend this product

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Barbara Bandoli
Reviews.Content: There are two issues with this monitor which, had I known about them, I would not have purchased it. First, when the battery dies it makes no sound indicating that it is about to happen. So unless you are constantly looking at, it will die and you won't notice. Second, when you turn it off while it is in standby mode it goes into standby the next time you turn it on, and for some reason then won't pick up any sounds or kick back to regular mode. You have to turn off standby mode either before you turn it off or as soon as you turn it on. Learned this the hard way when our baby was screaming and the monitor didn't pick it up.We have learned to deal within these annoyances, but had I known about them before, I would not have bought it.

Reviews.Title: I should have listened to my gut feeling
Reviews.Author: Meaghan Curtis
Reviews.Content: So I had done alot of research on baby monitors and was struggling to buy a pretty spendy motorola monitor b/c of such mixed reviews. Well I decided to look elsewhere and ran across this monitor. It had good reveiws and it was $100. Well I should have looked a little harder cause this monitor sucks! I had this thing less than a week and it already crapped out on me. First it made a weird noise, then it had this weird fuzzy bar at the bottom, then one day the whole picture was blurry and then later that same day there was no picture at all. First off I should have known better than to get some brand I have never heard of before. Second $100 is pretty spendy for how plastic-ey it is. No really it is like a mcdonalds toy. The so called "stand" is even cheaper plastic, I had to be super careful to set it down b/c it felt like it was going to snap off. And why is it that it gives the appearance of their being an option button on the front of the monitor where it says infant optics? Its like they put it there thinking they were going to give this monitor more options and then decided they were too lazy to do that and just left the appearance like that to fool buyers. My husband and I both fidgeted with it thinking it was a button. I read the instructions and made sure everything with our wireless router was up to date so there would be no interference. Something I noticed is that when I took the parent unit downstairs it would have a weak signal...really? How many people have two story houses and you didnt think to work out that kink? I dont like how there isnt a zoom or temperature guage on it, for $100 i think they could have added a little more than they did. Anyway, this thing is a piece of crap! Don't waste your time!

Reviews.Title: Lousy baby video monitor
Reviews.Author: SomeColoradoGuy
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes, but this video monitor fell way short. First, the microphone is so weak, it only picks up loud noises, like crying. It does not pick up the sound of baby breathing. Second, the brightness of the screen is annoyingly bright, even when turned down to the lowest setting. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: ok product
Reviews.Author: A. M. Thoufeeg
Reviews.Content: the communication works very well on this but the plastic cover looks very cheap and fragile. Also the mechanism stand for keeping the product upright is not very sturdy hence i am afraid i might break it while pulling it out.also battery life is 3 hours which is too short in the default mode.

Reviews.Title: It's Cheap... for a Reason
Reviews.Author: dblums
Reviews.Content: Poor build quality.Dropped it once and the antenna snapped off.Weeks later, it stopped working with batteries, so now must always be plugged in.Plus, it interferes with our wifi signal.Wish we'd spent a few extra bucks.  Learned my lesson: pay for it now or pay for it later.

Reviews.Title: Delivers the basic with flaws
Reviews.Author: Euclides Martinez
Reviews.Content: The good things I should say about this item is that it is neatly packed, is appealing and has good sound quality. Also the easy of use is a promise well kept.What it does not deliver acordingly is with relation the coverage and interfearance reduction feature, I have it in my apartment and if the baby is in the room I cant go to the kitchen with the monitor, and the distance is way smaller than specified in the product specs.Another thing is related with the batery duration, it lasts too litle...!!I gave it a chance and did not include any comment at the moment I received it but now after 2 months of usage my position is the same, I only gave it a chance and instead of 1 I gave 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Paul "Computer_Guy"
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything it says it does, however it leaves much to be desired. The construction is very light weight. The volume does not get very loud. the LCD picture quality was poor. This product is better than not having a video baby monitor at all, but there are much better video baby monitors available. Also, the AC adapter made a high pitched noise when it warmed up. I was going to have to get the AC adapter replaced, but I returned instead.

Reviews.Title: The product seems to be good
Reviews.Author: John Orozco
Reviews.Content: The product seems to be good but I didn't use it because I not found the battery for the monitor.Where is it? I waiting for seller answer before final review.

Reviews.Title: Buy with caution
Reviews.Author: miranda
Reviews.Content: My baby monitor stopped working after 2 days. I'm returning this product. Perhaps they just sent a bad baby monitor?

Reviews.Title: It works, but there are better ones for sure!
Reviews.Author: Iheartinky
Reviews.Content: I have used 5 different baby video monitors over the past 8 years (for more than one child obivously).  This one is my third favorite.  The sound is good, the screen resolution is fine.  The quality is awful.  I dropped the handheld unit onto CARPET and the antennae broke off immediately after two days of owning it.  It still works though.  I'm still on the lookout for a monitor that has all my favorite features built into one unit, which has yet to happen.PROS:AppearanceVideo QualitySound QualityEase of UseCONS:CHEAP, CHEAP, CHEAPButtons are located in bad spots.  When handling the monitor, you could accidentally turn it off without knowing it.The bracket on the back of the handheld unit is weird and cheap and I keep waiting for it to break.  Currently, it works.Missing lots of my favorite features!Okay, so here's what I would like to see in the "perfect" video baby monitor:TimeDateTemperature of baby's roomAble to "scan" or move the camera with the handheld remoteAbility to hit a button when I want video feed and not to have the monitor loudly click on with a bright video to wake me up everytime my child rolls over or coughs during the night.  Geesh!2 Cameras per handheld unit(for the price of one, ha ha)I have never found a need for color video.  Black and white is just fine. It's night, you know.A very well built handheld unit.  It's possible to knock these over in the middle of the night or to drop them when carrying them.  It would be nice if that didn't break them every time.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy.
Reviews.Author: Rebekah
Reviews.Content: I'm a first time mom, so take this with a grain of salt.  However, I'm also college educated (2 bachelors degrees and a masters), so I'd think some things would just be common sense for a baby product.  Here is my take on this monitor:1) If you accidentally forget to turn the camera on and turn the handheld monitor on first, the handheld issues an EXTREMELY LOUD series of beeps to alert that the camera is out of range.  Great if the camera is out of range, awful if you're standing right next to your sleeping infant because you wanted to check and make sure the camera angle was set properly.  Ooooops.2) The screen on the hand-held NEVER turns off.  EVER.  EVER, EVER, EVER.  Unless it runs out of batteries.  (I'll get to that in #3)  So now imagine you've gotten your sleeping bundle of joy to sleep and (gasp!) you want to sleep.  Nope.  The handheld will glow like the surface of the sun unless you cover it with something.  Then you cover it with something and muffle the sounds of your super impatient, hungry baby.  Oh, yes, the same baby that you couldn't see move because you had to cover the screen.  Oooops.3)  Let's say that you've overcome obstacles 1 and 2.  Now you're asleep, the tiny screaming bundle of joy is asleep, and the monitor is appropriately dimmed with an ironic eye mask that you should just put on your face.  Oh no!  You forgot to plug the handheld in to the wall.  Guess how long the battery lasts?  Answer: less time than your infant will sleep.  Because that's how Murphy's law works.  It WILL start beeping.  Loudly.  Everyone in the house will wake up.  You will throw the damned thing in the toilet and go online and write a review of this god-awful piece of crap that ruined your night.So, buy at your own risk!  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Infant Optics Video Monitor-very disappointing
Reviews.Author: Thomas V. Hubscher
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor and an additional camera after our old summer video monitor (which we loved) started to have some issues and we couldn't replace it b/c they don't make that model anymore.  We were hopeful based on the great reviews, but once we tried to use it, we were extremely disappointed.  The night vision on our unit is useless (even with several nighlights in the room), it is so pixelated that we can't see our daughter in her bed at all.  The sound, which others described as "tinny", is horrible.  I could hear my daughter more clearly through the door down the hall than through the monitor, it wasn't a volume issue, just very bad sound quality.  It also cut in and out with no rhyme or reason.  I definitely don't think that I would be at all comfortable using this monitor for an infant.  As it is, this was our daughter's first night in her big girl bed, and I'm having to sneak in to her room to make sure she is okay and still in her bed, because I can't even make out her form in the bed or hear anything.  We will most certainly be returning this product, since it doesn't work at all as described.  Maybe we were spoiled by our summer monitor, but I want to be able to see my child clearly in the light or dark and hear them.  I'm writing this review, because this product had a lot of 5 star reviews, and frankly, those swayed me to purchase it...I really can't conceive of how it gets so many glowing reviews even at the price point.

Reviews.Title: Not sure where the positive reviews are coming from...
Reviews.Author: TSBenton
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying that I usually do not take the time to review products unless I really feel it's necessary, such as with this video monitor.  This is our second video monitor, with our first being a Summer Infant, so I'm not completely new to how a video monitor should work.  I've owned this monitor for about 3 months.  One of the reasons I'm writing this review today is because I woke up to my son screaming and crying last night, and the monitor was sitting on the nightstand right next to me without a signal from the camera.  This happens CONSTANTLY, it will not stay connected to the base.The camera sits about 30' from the monitor, which is by no means out of the advertised signal range.  When it loses the signal, it warns the user with a loud beep.  About every other night, it will beep in the middle of the night waking me up, and I'll pick it up to check on my son only to realize that it beeped because the signal was lost, not because the camera base was picking up noise in his room.  The ONLY way I can get the signal to pick back up is to uplug the monitor from the wall and switch through all cameras (supports up to 4) until I get back to camera 1.  This makes no sense whatsoever.  When it's running on battery, the signal strength and connection is perfectly fine, but it can't run off battery all night.I have also found the voice activated power saving mode really takes excessive noise/commotion to wake up the monitor.  The camera sits about 3 feet from my son's crib, and when I'm directly below his room in our house, I can hear him moving around and kicking his mattress with the monitor still sleeping. The are a couple PROS, but the CONS really make it stand out.PROS:1) Price2) Video quality (when it has signal)CONS:1) Build quality2) Signal strength3) Voice activated power saving modeFrom my standpoint, I'm not sure where the positive reviews are coming from, this product is completely untrustworthy.  I would never rely on it for an infant, that's why our Summer Infant monitor is in our daughter's room.  Based on my experiences, spend a little more money and go with a Motorola or Summer Infant.  Hopefully this review will keep you from making the same mistake I did, if I could return it, I would.
